121211.content:
(Based on the beginning of episode 3- Misty and Ash just started traveling together through the Viridian forest)

Misty screamed as Ash looked back at her with a blank stare. They had just left Viridian City after Team Rocket had attacked it. She was screaming, cowering away from- “Oh wow its a Caterpie! Its one of the bug pokemon!”

Ash excitedly got out a pokeball and caught it as Misty continued to freak out over it. He gave her an exasperated look, “It's just a bug; you’re not afraid of a little ol’ Caterpie in a pokeball are you?” They continued to fight until Ash left, saying he’d go on without her.

Wanting her bike replaced (and not wanting to be alone in the bug-infested woods) she followed him, hiding behind trees as she went. Eventually he spotted her again and got irritated, “Why are you still following us?!”
“I-I’m holding you responsible for the replacement of my bike, that’s why!” Misty said annoyed. Ash huffed at that statement, obviously not too worried about repaying her.

“When are you going to get over that dumb bike anyways?” Ash said, pissing off Misty even more.

“You’re the dumb one, Mr. ‘Pokemon Master’! If you hadn’t destroyed my bike I could’ve been gone already!” She said getting frustrated that this kid destroyed her bike and wasn’t keen on replacing it anytime soon.

“I said I’d replace it someday! And if I’m so dumb why are you following me?!” Ash said equally frustrated. Misty growled a bit.

“This just happens to be the fastest way to Pewter City! I’m not following you- and what good is it if I don’t get my bike replaced soon?!” Misty said angrily as Ash huffed and began walking away. Fuming, she grabbed her pokeball and threw at Ash’s head.

“WAH-?!” Ash stumbled at the hit and then was knocked to the ground as Goldeen came out of the ball and landed squarely on his head. Misty stomped over to him while he was stunned, Pikachu watching her curiously as she did so.

She almost yelled at him while he was lying down groaning- but a flash of white caught her eye. She smirked, before reaching down for the waistband poking out of the boy’s jeans. As she grasped it, she noticed Ash didn’t really notice with Goldeen flopping about on his head. Well she’d change that!

“What the- AAAAAGH!” Ash suddenly was being pulled up by his waistband, the cotton being shoved viciously into his butt by Misty’s anger-fueled wedgie, “St-stoppit!” Misty laughed as she pulled the boy’s butt up higher. She began bouncing him as he yelped, his briefs’ legholes now visible as they flew deeper and deeper into his ass.

Misty knew her strength wouldn’t last much longer and that Ash probably would get the upper hand and take revenge. She quickly noticed a low hanging branch and began carrying a squealing Ash over to it, his briefs up to his upper back by this point.

She was going to leave him up there for a bit until he agreed to her demands- or maybe something else would be better...

12121111.content:
“Here’s how this is going to work- we’ll go along on your little adventure, Mr. Pokemon Master,” She said walking around him as he groaned from the cotton shoved deep up his ass. He hadn’t received many wedgies over the years- a few from Gary when they were younger was really the limit.

It had never been this bad and he had certainly never been hung up like this. It stung painfully and he was willing to listen to his new travel “companion”’s demands.

“But you are paying for my expenses- I’ll help cover stuff when I feel like it. And this is what our relationship will be until I get my bike. You, submissive and accepting of what I want. Makes sense?”

Ash was clearly hesitant about such a deal which just made Misty smirk. She could do this all day. She got around him again, picking up a nearby branch that was flattish, “Here let me persuade you, Ash.”

“AAAAAAAAAAGH!” Ash squealed loudly as the tree branch slammed into his denim-covered butt with all the strength Misty had left (which was still a lot to the boy who had only been spanked by his mother’s hand, never by a branch).

It sent him swinging, grinding his already awful wedgie deeper into his ass, the pain beginning fresh as the momentum put pressure onto his crotch before swinging him back to shove it back up his butt. “I haven’t heard a ‘Yes Ma’am’ yet Ash!” Misty laughed before spanking him again with the branch.

After five strikes from the branch Ash was on the verge of tears but held strong. He wouldn’t let her win! At least, that was what he thought as Misty circled around front. She looked him over before reaching up and undoing his jeans. He tried to hold them up but she smacked his red behind, causing Ash to yelp and let them drop to his ankles.

Misty laughed at the site, the pitiful and foolhardy boy swinging from a branch, tighty whities shoved deep up his ass and exposing his now red butt to the world. Ash’s cheeks burned in humiliation, desperately hoping he could escape. His spirit was at its breaking point. Maybe he could get his pokemon to save his sore butt!
12121111.title: Misty has some fun with Ash while he hangs by h...

121211112.content:
But then again.. Maybe she could be of some help to him, aside from the wedgie and smacks to the butt he was currently on the receiving end of.

He was still just a rookie, considering he'd just started his journey as a trainer a day or so ago. Whereas with this girl, even though she was temperamental, something about her told him that she knew a lot more about being a trainer than he did..

"Wait! St-AHP " Ash exclaimed in discomfort; "ALL RIGHT! YES M'AM!!"

Misty put the branch down, raised an eyebrow as she circled back in front of the boy.

"I'll agree to your conditions! But I want to add something.." Ash looked up at Misty, "I.. Well.. That's to say... I just started my journey as a trainer, and-"

"Let me guess... You want some pointers?" Misty asked while placing her hands on her hips.

The boy nodded, swallowing his pride.

Misty looked at Ash in thought. She was still angry at him for wrecking her bike, that much was certain. But, now that she had some time to calm down, she was able to think clearly.

As soon she came to a decision, she got back onto the stump, and unhooked his briefs from the branch of the tree, causing him to fall back to the forest floor on his face. He shook himself out of his dizziness as he sat cross legged. Misty then knelt down in front of him, giving him a less angry and more firm look as he pulled his jeans back up.

"All right, listen up.... The only reason I'm willing to agree to this deal is simple.." Misty visibly relaxed as she looked at him, "Even though you took my bike, and got it demolished.. You did it to save your Pikachu.." She gave a slight smirk, "Don't get me wrong, you still owe me a bike, so my conditions on you submitting will still stand... But, I have to admit.. Any trainer that's willing to risk his neck out there for his Pokemon can't be all that bad. You do have some potential Ash, you just need some help unlocking it.. Which is why, I'm gonna make sure you work your butt off while you're learning from me.. Got it?"

Misty put her fist against Ash's’ chin, and pushed it a bit sideways in a playful, cuffing gesture.

"Got it.." Ash held the urge to grin while finishing redoing his belt.

Misty got to her feet, helping the young trainer up. She then grasped Ash by the waistband once again, leading him by the underwear rather than wedgieing him (for now at least).

"C'mon rookie, we need to get to Pewter before nightfall."

1212111122.content:
Ash wasn’t entirely thrilled by being led by his briefs; the idea that Misty saw a pokemon master in him though made up for it (and it was certainly helped by the fact that he didn’t dare tell her to stop). He caught a pidgeotto that day as well, much to his joy.

He had messed up a bit- sending his poor caterpie out to fight it when it was a flying type. Misty had let him know VERY quickly what she thought about that, his undies refinding their new secondary home up his butt. Ash quickly had Pikachu defeat it so he could capture it.

“Birds eat worms like yours Ash! Pokemon isn’t just about throwing one creature at another- they are only effective if their trainer is thinking!” She said, lecturing him, Ash sitting sheepishly on the ground cross legged.

“I’m sorry Misty, I wasn’t thinking clearly. I just thought that Caterpie needed his time to shine!” He said enthusiastically.

Misty sighed, smiling a little, “I know that’s what you want, but something like pidgeotto isn’t something you throw a Caterpie at. And you did all this after forgetting you needed to weaken pokemon to catch them first, one of the basic rules of catching pokemon!”

She shook her head in fond exasperation, “You’re so hard headed sometimes. But you need to drill it into your head- many of a pokemon’s weaknesses are self explanatory. Grass gets burned up by Fire which is weakened by Water which is soaked up by Grass again. But advantages like this can make the world of a difference!”

Ash nodded furiously, “I understand! I’ll do my best to memorize my pokemons’ weaknesses!”

Misty nodded happily, “I’m sure you will!” They both squealed when web-like string suddenly shot up next to them. They both stopped when they saw it was only Caterpie forming a cocoon around itself, “Oh its evolving!” It turned into a Metapod, the cocoon stage of the bug’s life.

The other kid jumped up celebrating and hugging his Metapod, not really caring about the briefs still in his butt. Misty laughed before noticing the sun was almost set, “Looks like we’re not making it our today. Tomorrow then; best set up camp in that case.”
They did so, getting a fire going and eating before his mentor turned to him, “Alright Ash, while I know you’re still learning, I want to reinforce today’s lesson for you. Since Caterpie, the one you put in danger, is in a cocoon you’ll join him.”

Ash looked at her blankly as she got his sleeping bag out, “Wha-Whadda ya mean?”

She pulled him gently by the briefs, “Oh simple!” she grabbed some rope and threaded one rope through one leghole, then another through the other leghole. She then pulled them up, wedgieing Ash’s briefs up his butt and his tighty whities climbed up his sides.

When she was done, the legholes were halfway up his body, held there on the sides by two ropes that looped over a shoulder and through the legholes. Ash squirmed in the permanent wedgie, which honestly only seemed to make it worse.

Misty explained, “You’ll be staying like that for the night in your sleeping bag like Metapod. Hopefully after tonight I’ll never have to do this again…?”

Ash furiously nodded, “Yes Misty, the lesson is being- ugh -learned!”

“Good! Then i’ll be taking these as collateral,” She said removing his pants and belt, “You can get them back in the morning. Take off the wedgie and you’ll be walking around pantsless tomorrow.” Ash blushed as she did take them off but nodded and got in his sleeping bag. Shortly thereafter, Misty went to sleep as well.

It was really hard for Ash to sleep, thanks to his briefs constantly digging into him with the ropes keeping them like that. Of course, this would be highly uncomfortable for anyone to have to deal with, but that's beside the point.

Throughout the night, Ash was tempted to take the ropes off and undo his cheek splitting wedgie. But the warning that Misty gave him kept him from doing this, since it was better to get his pants back first thing in the morning than to go pantless for nearly a day.

Something tells me my underwear's gonna be taking a hiking quite a lot from her throughout my journey.. But it'll be worth it, if it means I become a great Pokemon trainer.. Ash thought as he looked at his new coach/mentor as she snoozed in her sleeping bag. He looked up into the stars as he pondered something that he never thought of before. I wonder if Dad ever went through something like this.. I mean.. Mom DID say that she gave him an atomic wedgie when they first met...

He stifled a chuckle at the thought.. His own mother, the sweet and caring woman who raised him from birth on her own, giving someone a WEDGIE of all things.

As he let sleep overtake him, he drifted off into slumberland so he could dream of making it big as a trainer.
-

The next morning, Ash's eyes fluttered open, yawning as he stretched up, greeting Pikachu with a scratch behind the ears.

He turned his head, as he watched Misty wake up as well, stretching out her body as she felt her bones pop a bit.

Misty crawled out of her sleeping bag and zipped Ash's own sleeping bag open a bit to check. She smiled as she saw that Ash had kept the wedgie in.

"Good, you kept your promise!" Misty handed her companion back his pants, "You can undo the ropes now.."

Ash gladly did so, getting out of his sleeping bag and untying the ropes until his undergarments were free.

After digging his briefs out of his crack and putting his pants back on, the two of them (along with their Pokemon) had a quick breakfast.

"Before we get going, I think you deserve a heads up. The Pewter City Gym specializes in rock type Pokemon.. And considering that some of the leader's Pokemon might be ground types as well, I think Pikachu needs to sit it out.."

Ash wanted to protest, but he knew she was more than likely right.. From what he'd heard in one of the trainer booklets, electric Pokemon like Pikachu don't work too well against those type of Pokemon.

"I guess... I could get a water type.."

"You got it!" Misty smiled at Ash's words, gently knocking him on the head "You see? There's a benefit to using your brain.."

121211112211.content:
“But, we’re in Virdian forest! Where are we going to find water pokemon out here?” Ash asked worriedly.

Misty shrugged, “There’s probably a river running through here- We just need to find it!”

And so the two searched for most of the morning, stopping only for lunch. They were tired and frustrated that they couldn’t find a source of water. “Oh who needs a water pokemon, I don’t need them! My pokemon will do just fine!”

Misty rolled her eyes, “Flying pokemon are weak to rock types Ash. And your metapod isn’t fighting anything till it evolves. You have no way of beating the gym leader.”

Ash sulked, knowing she was right but wishing there was a way around searching, “Why can’t I just use one of your pokemon Misty? You already have water type pokemon!”

“Cause that’d be cheating! Well, not cheating but it might as well be! How can you become a pokemon master if you can’t catch all types and use them well?” Misty said, keeping her pokemon near her. She blinked, “Is that a Krabby?”

Ash jumped up startled, “Whaaaaa-?!” As a Krabby pinched its claws playfully before scurrying away, “I’m gonna catch it!” Ash shouted chasing after it.

Misty stood up quickly, “Ash you’re forgetting your pokemon!” But it was no use, he was already gone. She groaned, turned to Pikachu, “Come on, we need to catch up to him.”

“Pika-piiiiii,” Pikachu agreed, running after Ash with Misty.

1212111122112.content:
Never knew a krabby could move so fast! Ash thought to himself in amazement as he ran after the little crab-like Pokemon, which was scuttling at an impressive speed. Makes me want to catch the little guy more!

Despite how fast the little crab was, Ash's determination allowed him to keep on running.

After running through a bush, Ash saw a lake a yard ahead, and knew that if he didn't get a boost of speed, Kraby would have a major advantage in the water.

So with renewed vigor, Ash picked up the pace, slowly and surely getting closer, and closer, until he was about ten feet behind the Pokemon. Just as he was about to reach for a pokeball however..

A net sprung out from behind some shrubbery, and promptly caught the little Pokemon. Because of how sudden it occurred, it stunned the crab quite a bit, to the point where it wasn't trying to snip its way out of the net with his claws while being dragged towards the shrubbery .

Ash gapped in shock at what just happened, with his fears being unfortunately confirmed as he saw the net with Krabby inside of it being picked up by the domineering hand of the Team Rocket member, Jessie.

"Quite da catch of da day, eh?" Meowth quipped as the feline popped out of the shrubbery.

"I'll say!" James said as he too popped out, "It-"

James stopped in mid-sentence, as all of three Team Rocket members looked at Ash.

"You again!" Jessie growled angrily.

"We lost a haul of Pokemon because of you and that Pikachu!"

Ash sweated a bit nervously as he reached behind himself to get out his Pidgeotto's pokeball, hoping to fight them off.. Only to realize..

It's not there! It... I must've left the pokeball behind back at camp!.. And Pikachu's not nearby.. Thiiiiis could get messy..

But that wouldn't stop him from rescuing the little crab Pokemon from their clutches, no sir.. Instead, he quickly grabbed a small rock from the ground and threw it at Jessie's hand. This caused him to release the krabby from her clutch as she yelled out in pain.

"Run little guy! Get outta here, go!" Ash called out to the Krabby. The sound was enough to snap the little Pokemon out of his stupor as he snipped his way out of the net. He briefly gave Ash a look of what appeared to be surprise, but nonetheless scuttled off in a hurry in the opposite direction, even faster than before.

While the three Pokemon thieves were angry, they stopped as Meowth looked closer at Ash as a realization popped into his head.

"Hey fellas! Check it out.. Da twoip forgot ta bring his Pokemon with him.. " Meowth said, a smug grin adorned on his feline face.

"Oh really?" Jessie asked, as a smiliar grin formed on her face.

"Pretty big mistake for a trainer to make.." James said, cracking his knuckles with anticipation.

Ash gulped a bit, slowly backing away from the three as a pit formed in his stomach.

Misty looked at Ash as he and Pikachu were walking side by side, with Poliwag naturally accompanying them.

While she had been officially caught, she wasn't QUITE used to the idea of a poke avail, though she agreed to try it out once they were in Pewter City.

Before they left, Ash used his pokedex to figure out what moves his new water type had. She had the following in her repertoire; Water Gun, Hypnosis and Double Slap; with Mud Shot as an egg move apparently.

And despite her species not being as adept on land as they were in the water in this form, Poliwag did still nonetheless seem to be capable enough on land.This would be especially necessary since there was no pool of water for her to hide in at the Pewter Gym.

Ash opted to go with Pidgeotto as his second Pokemon for the battle, since Pikacu's electric attacks wouldn't have much effect (far less to the point of useless if it turned out the gym leader's Pokemon were part ground type), and Metapod wouldn't be able to maneuver much until he evolved. Plus, while he was at a disadvantage against Rock type moves, being a flying type still more or less made him immune to ground type moves.

It did help that along the way, Pidgeotto managed to get a warm up after warding off a swarm of beedrill alongside Pikachu, Poliwag and Misty's Staryu. He even managed to naturally learn the move, Double Team, on his own, which would definitely come in handy for the gym.

Eventually, they arrived at Pewter City, where a mysterious rock seller with a beard briefly greeted them.

And upon arriving at the Pokemon Center, everyone rested for the night. With Ash focused, and ready for the battle that would occur tomorrow.

As soon as the sun was nearly finished setting, the group arrived at the Pokemon Center.

Naturally, Ash and Misty got their Pokemon checked out, until it was found they were in good enough condition to battle tomorrow.

Poliwag, of course, naturally kept true to her word, and tried out being in a pokeball.. Only to find that it wasn't exactly quite as great as being out of it. So naturally, Ash had to compromise. She'd be allowed to be out of her poke all most of the time like Pikachu, but if a situation calls for it, she will go into her ball without complaints. That was fine with the little water type, finding it a fair deal.

Though as soon as Ash was ready for bed, he looked at Misty with a curious look.

"Hey Mist.."

"Yeah Ash?" She asked the boy, a bit surprised that he called her by a nickname.

"I gotta ask.. How come you specialize in Water type Pokemon?" Ash asked with a raised eyebrow; "The only other people that I've heard of specializing in it are the Sensational Sisters in Cerulean Gym.."

Misty froze up just a tad, both because she was not expecting such a question, and because he mentioned Cerulean. Thankfully she recovered a bit, and smiled.

"Well... That's my secret to have.." Misty said casually, but than grew a playful smile; "But I'm willing to give it out if you're willing to work for it.."

She then suddenly walked up to him, calmly taking his hat off his head. Before he could even ask what she was doing, she suddenly got him in a headlock with her right arm and began to give him a noogie with her left hand.

"Hey! Quit it!" Ash said with a boyish grin as he felt the taller girl rub her knuckles atop his black hair.

"Make me!" Misty laughed as she wrestled the boy to the floor, not letting up with the noogie.

Poliwag and Pikachu simply looked with amusement, letting the two roughhouse.

The rough housing continued on, with Ash eventually escaping the noogie and trying desperately to turn the tables on her, only for Misty to counter his every attempt.

It all culminated to where Misty had successfully gotten the shorter boy on his bed, sitting on his back and keeping his arms pinned down with her legs. Naturally? Misty reached down, and yanked on his undies. Not enough to give a NUCLEAR wedgie of course, though just enough to get the point across that he was losing..

Poliwag honestly didn't know why her new trainer's companion was so interested in tugging on his underpants..

Pikachu natrually filled her in on everything that had before they met up with each other.. Though of course, he added that he had next to no idea why Misty would even choose WEDGIES of all things, but he supposed her tomboyish nature had something to do with it..

Poliwag naturally gave Misty a look of confusion, but naturally shrugged her... Body.....?

Eh, perhaps she'd try to learn the appeal of wedgie giving when she evolved into a Poliwhirl.
1212111122211112112111.title: They find a place to stay the night, and Misty ...

12121111222111121121111.content:
It was early in the morning, around seven am when Ash woke up, stretching out a bit and yawning softly.

After getting out of bed, he gently woke his two Pokemon up, letting them know today was the gym battle.

Poliwag's eyes naturally gleamed with excitement as she jumped onto his shoulder, looking ready to go.

Of course they had to wait for Misty, after which they'd have breakfast.. As Pikachu's stomach growling indicated..
~~~~~~~~~~

Ash stood at the door, breathing in and out to calm his nerves.. He knew if he wanted to do well in his first gym battle, he'd need to keep his cool.

It didn't stop him from having butterfrees form in his belly, but he was willing to press forward.

He worked hard, and had Misty as a great coach, regardless of her unusual "methods".. He could do this..

After opening the doors, the two humans and two Pokemon walked into the gym, where across from them, stood a teen boy, a couple years older than them and taller. With rather squinty eyes, tan skin (almost brown really), a green vest, an orange shirt, and brown pants.

"Name's Brock.. Have you come to challenge the Pewter City Gym?" The teen asked.

"Yes, my name's Ash Ketchum from Pallet Town, and I'm here for my first gym battle!"

"Straight to the point I see.." Brock said with a small smile; "Well, Ash, let's see how well you do.. Hope you're ready."

Ash nodded, as he grabbed Pidgeotto's pokeball, and brought him out.

Brock raised an eyebrow at the odd choice.. Something told him the rookie had something up his sleeve, so he knew he'd best not get overconfident despite the type advantage Brock's Pokemon had, especially since ground type moves wouldn't work on Pidgeotto.

"Geodude, your'e up!" Brock threw the pokeball containing the small pebble like Pokemon with muscular arms.

"Geo!"

Misty looked on at the two.. Win or lose, she knew that despite being a rookie, Ash will proven himself.
12121111222111121121111.title: The next day, Ash's very first gym battle b...

choices: Ash and Misty head out to celebrate his first win, YAHOOOO!
...but first, Misty opts to wedgie him. Have to keep that ego in check after all
121211112221111211211111.content:
Ash's plan for victory had been relatively simple. Figuring that the gym leaders wouldn't use his strongest Pokemon first, The idea was to at least soften said Pokemon up with Pidgeotto if his flying type wasn't strong enough to beat it. Then Poliwag would be able to clear a win easily enough and have a better chance against whatever Brock's second Pokemon would be.

Misty's 'lessons' had definitely gotten him to start thinking more. To think, I might have actually tried to win with Pikachu before.

For a moment, everything was quiet, until Brock made the first move: "Geodude, use tackle!"

"geo!"

The battle was on as Ash quickly had Pidgeotto dodge before returning fire with a gust attack to try and knock Geodude back. However the rock was undeterred!

Naturally, Geodude retaliated by throwing a stone at the bird, which he avoided, only to receive a Mega Punch to the face, sending the bird reeling until he regained his senses and up righted himself. Geodude naturally grabbed him with his burly hands and got ready for a Seismic Toss, only to be countered with a Peck Attack to the face. While the bird did manage to get away, the peck to Geodude's face only annoyed the rock type Pokemon rather than do much damage.

Pidgeotto avoided another tackle attack, and transitioned to using Double Team. As he flew at Geodude, his entire body had a white outline around it. And as a result, the bird created multiple copies of himself.

Geodude attempted a tackle, but phased through one of them, leading to him receiving a blow from above, courtesy of Pidgeotto using Quick attack, which allowed him to move at a speed that allowed him to be almost invisible, made more effective when Pidgeotto used the momentum while he focused the full force at his beak while lunging, with the smaller surface area allowing the impact to be more condensed.

The rock type recovered after landing on the field, and went underground using dig. Geodude came out of the ground, finding that Pidgeotto had flown almost all the way to the ceiling, leaving him unable to get any higher. Thus he was ready to use a Mega Punch once again.. And if Pidgeotto tried going down, he'd only find himself getting intercepted by Geodude.

But what he did next made Ash grin with impressment.

After hovering back down a bit, Pidgeotto deftly moved to the side while using both talons to grab Geodude by each one of his muscular forearms, using both his side-flap AND Geodude's momentum to start dive bombing to gain even greater speed. Emphasis on speed, as this tactic required a great deal of it, otherwise Geodude would be able to recover and retaliate.

Like a rocket of feathers and stone, the two sped downwards until Pidgeotto gained sufficient velocity. After pulling up back into a sort of loop, Pidgeotto didn't let the momentum and speed go to waste as he promptly chucked the rock Pokemon into the side of one of the largest rock formations on the field, leaving a Geodude's sized hole.

The battle grew intense with both Pokemon starting to look tired, the unexpected happened. Pidgeotto had just dodged again and Ash had called out for a whirlwind attack to push Geodude further while using Geodude's momentum to get a better result, but got something unexpected instead...

"Pidgeoooo!" As the bird flapped his wings, the gusts of wind suddenly gathered around until it formed a sort of cyclone of sorts.. A literal whirlwind if you will, proceeding to let it engulf Geodude. The centrifugal forces being too much, as the tornado promptly slammed him into the field, hard.

Dexter obviously voiced his commentary.

Twister. A dragon type move. This move allows the user to send a tornado at an opponent.

"Woah, I didn't know you had that attack!" Said Ash.

Brock also looked surprised as he returned Geodude to his pokeball for a well earned rest. "That's the thing about being a trainer I suppose. Pokemon are just full of surprises."

"Yeah, I guess you're right." Turning to his Pidegotto, who had collapsed to the ground in exhaustion, though he was still awake and covered in bruises underneath his feathers..

Ash opted to let him rest rather than send him into the next fight. "Get some rest pal, you've earned it."

Pidgeotto chirped back.

Now it was time for round two. Poliwag vs Onyx. As Brock watched Poliwag stepped up to fight, he suddenly felt himself start to chuckle.

"Hey, what's so funny?!" Ash demanded.

"I don't know why, but for just a second there, I had this weird feeling you were going to try an use Pikachu." That thought suddenly had both Ash and Misty laughing as well. After all, using a small electric mouse to fight a giant snake made out of stone? What sort of idiotic, completely insane fool would do that?

Anyway, before it began, Ash breathed in and out in order to calm himself. As he did, Poliwag looked at him. She nodded in reassurance that she'd give it all she had, giving the trainer her faith in his skills as a battler.

"All right.." Ash grinned; "Let's get this thing started!"

Poliwag started off with a Water Gun, only for Onix to evade with surprising quickness for a Pokemon his size. Likely, this was because of his experiences in gym battles, allowing him to compensate for whatever disadvantage he'd find himself in, especially opponents that were water type Pokemon.

In retaliation, Onix attempted to slap Poliwag with his tail, only for the water type to hit the dirt. While the blow didn't connect in the slightest after she ducked, the strong breeze from how fast it was certainly blew the smaller Pokemon away about a couple meters back. Thankfully, she managed to land on her stubby little feet.

After an attempt to swipe at her with his tail again, she hopped back to get some distance while also launching another water gun. Onix naturally avoided this yet again, and promptly began charging, or would that be slithering?

Poliwag got out of there, knowing that meeting the attack head on was stupid. She could try to run away until he got tired and make himself easer for her to finish him off with a Water Gun or two. But she and her trainer knew that Onix probably wouldn't even tire out that easily.. So instead, this battle would have to be done similarly with Pidgeotto and Geodude's battle.

Thankfully, Poliwag had plenty of places to hide, due to her size, how big the field was, and the plentiful amount of rocks there were on the field!

As Onix went past one of the biggest, he groaned a bit in pain as the side of his head felt a forceful shot of water pelt it. Turning his head to where it came from, he slowly moved towards what looked to be the same rock formation Geodude smashed into, only for the other side of his head to feel the same shot of water that hit him.

With a grimace, Onix turned his head and looked around. Brock knew that Onix's size was a bit of a double edged sword, since it made him a larger target, which is why he had Onix use Dig.

As Poliwag looked around for Onix, she felt a rumbling, about 4 meters to her right. She immediately started running again, only to feel the shockwave resulting from Onix suddenly popping out of the ground in front of her, knocking her back and hitting one of the boulders.

She got to her stubby feet the best that a Pokemon with no arms could, and used her tail to help shake off the dizziness. Only for Onix to come back up again, this time from behind. Poliwag was thrown like a ragdoll, though she landed on her feet this time.

This didn't look good at all, since Onix was now playing the game of guerrilla warefare with Poliwag. Since Onix himself now had a place to hide, there was no telling when he'd pop up again, and he'd more than likely intercept Poliwag again if she tried to run. He wasn't sure if Poliwag could even TAKE much more from this..

Wait a minute.. Ash thought to himself as the gears in his head turned... Until he hit upon an idea.

As Poliwag was gathering her senses, she heard her trainer call out to her. Telling her to run and wait until he said otherwise. Knowing that her trainer had a trick up his sleeve, she began running as fast her little feet could carry her.

As she felt the rumbling in front of her, Ash told her to jump into the air as hard as she could and use Hypnosis. She did so, jumping into the air surprisingly high (likely due to her frog like physiology). As Onix's large head popped up again as if he were playing "Whack-A-Mole" , Poliwag's eyes were glowing blue.

When the rock Pokemon made eye contact with Poliwag, his eyes became dull.

With Onix now in a trance, Poliwag took the initiative and began pelting him with Water Gun after Water Gun, until he was looking like he could collapse. With him just standing there, Poliwag knew this was her chance, hopping onto her opponent's tail and running up his body until she got to the head.

She used it as a platform to hop away, opening her mouth while in mid-air and using Mud Shot, hurling multiple round globs of mud at high speed towards Onix...

As the mud made contact with Onix, Poliwag landed on a pillar of stone, panting a bit as she watched the toppled giant crash to the floor. She was surprised, but glad all the same.

The little thing was so exhausted she was actually happy to get some rest inside her Pokeball..

And just like that?... Ash had effectively won his very first gym battle.

Tomorrow because Ash definitely wanted Pidgeotto and Poliwag to join in on the fun, and Misty had recommended that he drop those two off at a Pokemon Center so that they could rest up.

Back in their, Ash was happily staring at his first gym badge while Misty looked at him with both amusement and a hint of pride. pride that he had taken her lessons to heart, and amusement because of just how transfixed he seemed by it. "Glad to see you're enjoying your victory Ashy boy."

"You bet I am!" he said excitedly. "With my skills and you as a teacher, I'll be unstoppable!" he pumped his fist, showing his conviction and enthusiasm.

Misty just smirked. "Careful you don't get a big head there Ash." she cautioned.

"Yeah yeah, I know." he said waving off her concern.

Well, that's bad sign. he didn't seem to be taking her warning very seriously. Better do something about that. Creeping up behind him, she reached her hand down the pack of his pants, grabbing his briefs and pulling hard.

"Gahhhhh! Oh come o-AH-on!"

"You only have yourself to blame for waving off my warning." she said while tugging harder and pulling him up off of the bed.

"Owww!, I'm so-ow-rry!"

First stretching the briefs up over his head and then grabbing the legholes to wedgie him further, completely exposing his butt-cheeks in the process. By the time she was finished, Ash just groaned in agony while squirming after she tossed him back onto the bed. "owhowowowowhowow! Okay, lesson learned." He gasped as a quick slap was delivered to his backside, letting out a quieter "ow." That one actually hadn't been every hard.

"Good, that means I'm doing my job right." her eyes traveled over his stretched out tighty whities as a thought occurred to her. "You know, you're definitely going to be needing some more undies soon. What do you say we go out and get you some."

"What?!" Having to go underwear shopping was something he realized that he would probably need to do if he was going to handle Misty's... 'unorthodox' teaching methods. But going underwear shopping WITH her. Correction, going underwear shopping with A GIRL! Not something that a ten year old boy, or any boy really, looked forward to.

"Well, I could just get you some myself, but then you'd have no say at all in what you get. Maybe I could find some underoos somewhere."

Still in his atomic wedgie and without pants, Ash made his way over to the room's couch, grabbed the remote, and turned on the TV. "Might as well do something while I wait." Indeed, aside from watching TV, there wasn't much he COULD do in his current situation. he began absentmindedly flipping through the channels.

"Pika pi." Ash turned his head towards his little electric mouse as it called for his attention.

"What is it Pikachu?" The small Pokemon gestured to the book it had dragged over. "You want me to read you a book?" Pikachu shook his head and opened the book himself and acted like he was reading it. "Huh, ummmm, I don't really get what youre..." He paused as Pikachu began to mime out the act of writing something.

At that moment, Ash began to realize that it was turning into a sort of Simon Says game. "Okaaaay, let's see. You're reading, and also writing. Hmmm. Taking notes? he guessed. Pikachu and gestured for him to continue. "Ummm, okay. taking notes. Uh, studying?" Again, he received a nod. "Alright, but why...?" And then something clicked in Ash's head. "Ugh, right, I needed to get a Pokemon book to study! Guess i should have gone with Misty when I had to chance." Cursing his misfortune, Ash looked back at the screen, hoping that his decision would not bring any more regrets.

Half an Hour Later


As Ash was watching TV, he suddenly heard the lock to the room's door being undone. Worried about the chance that it might end up being someone other than his redheaded companion, Ash began to rush toward the covers of his bed until he heard Misty's familiar voice. "Oh Ash, I'm back."

The boy breathed a sigh of relief. "Hey Misty. Everything go okay?"

She smiled as she tossed a shopping bag over to him, which he caught. "Yep. And now that I'm back, I can remove your wedgie."

Ash sighed as Misty removed his briefs from his head, although he did yelp when the waistband snapped back to his butt. "Ahh, soooo much better." His relief would not last long though. Looking into the bag, Ash found his earlier fears were correct. "Oh come on!" He complained as he saw that the bag was filled with multiple different types of underoos. Misty giggle as she watch him examine the different types. The green ones with grass Pokemon designs, a pack that featured designs resembling some of the legendary Pokemon, some Pikachu themed ones, and... "Are you kidding me?!!" The pink pairs covered with images of Skitty. The poor boy's face was completely red.

"Hey, I warned that you might not like what I get."

He knew that, bu this last pack was ridiculous. "Yeah, but these?!" he held up the pack of underoos baring Skitty's image. "These are clearly meant for girls! I can't wear these!"

With that, Misty saw an opportunity to have some more fun with the boy. "Hmmm, you may have a point." She saw a bit of hope start to form on Ash's face. "I'll tell you what, let's make a little bet. If you win, I'll get rid of the Skitty-themed underoos. However, If I win, then not only do we get rid of what's left of your tighty whities and your swim suit so that you'll have to wear underoos, even when you're swimming, but you also have to get a spanking before bed every night for a week."

Ash gulped. On one hand, those terms meant risking a lot just to get rid of a few pairs of underoos. On the other hand, these were some pretty demeaning underoos. "W-what's the actual challenge?" he asked, and felt himself shiver at the grin that appeared on the girl's face.

Ash looked at Poliwag, feeling nervous about his current situation. water types and their attacks were not something he had much knowledge of. In all honesty, it had always been the fire and grass types that had interested him more. Well, this couldn't be too hard. Could it? A shame he had never heard of 'famous last words' before.

25 Minutes later


"Well, that could have gone better. Though, I suppose it could have been worse too. Right?" SMACK

"Gah! Right ma'am." SMACK SMACK. "OWWWWwww!" At the moment, Misty was giving Ash a few spanks to encourage him to try and read more about Pokemon when they get the chance. SMACK. "AH!" At least I'm on my feat for this instead of hanging from a tree or laying over her lap. Right? Those thoughts made his face turn as red as his cheeks were starting to get.

"I mean, you have figured out all of her attacks now. Even if I did have to hold your hand through most of it." It was true, and Poliwag did have a nice array of attacks. On tiop of water gun, she also had Double Slap, Hypnosis, and MUD SHOT of all things. Smack

"Ow."

"Honestly, why did you think she'd be able to use bubble beam? She'd be right on the cusp of evolving if she could use that now." SMACK.

"OW! Give me a break! We only figured out she had mudshot because she decided to show us." He immediately shut his mouth after that, realizing too late that it was easily considered back talk.

Instead, however, Misty paused in delivering his spanking. "Hmmm, yeah, you do have a point there." Even she had been surprised by that. "Well, I guess this should do for a lesson. And we do need to get moving if we want to have plenty of time look around when we reach the city." Briefly, she considered putting him back into the atomic wedgie she had been prepared to leave him in until reaching the city earlier. However, she figured that she'd let it slide. Like she said earlier, he could have done worse.

Muttering a quick "thanks," Ash started walking forward while rubbing his sore bottom. Great. he thought. Stripped down to my underwear and spanked. That's it, first chance I get, I'm grabbing a book on Pokemon and studying like I've never studied before. A task that wouldn't be too large given the minimal amount of studying he'd done in the past. That being said, one would wonder if he could actually focus enough to do it.

As they journeyed forward, Misty felt better than ever. Her journey with this boy was only just get started, and she couldn't deny that she had been having A LOT of fun 'teaching' him. Almost makes me glad he wrecked my bike. Almost.

After a while, they did start to see Pewter City in the distance.
12121111222111121122.title: Lack of knowledge leads to a lack of clothes.

Thankfully, there was pretty much no one else around but them, otherwise they'd have seen a sight that most likely would have caused no end of embarrassment for the poor boy she was traveling with. She turned her head at Ash, giving the boy back his clothes.

"Here.. I think you've walked around in your undies long enough.." Misty handed them to the boy, who gratefully nodded and immediately got them on.

As soon as Ash hit his bed that night, he was out like a light. Since tomorrow promised to be a very important step in his journey, Misty let him get to sleep without any more wedgies. She did make him sleep in just his briefs though, something that reminded Ash that he needed to pick up a book on Pokemon knowledge after his gym battle if he wanted his chances of avoiding embarrassing punishments to improve.

Morning


With the big day here and Ash well rested, he woke up bright and early in preparation for the day. He was up before the room's alarm could even wake him. Wait, that can't be-

"GAH!" Ah yes, now I remember. "What's going oAHHHHN! Ow ow ow ow!" Misty, being the helpful mentor she is, had decided to wake him up herself just minutes before his alarm would have. And of course, what better way to wake up than with a...

"Shoulder wedgie!" Misty cried out as she continued yanking his briefs up his back. Once her task was complete, she let the boy get up more normally as he started undoing his wedgie. "now that you're nice and awake, I can give you the good news: breakfast is already set."

"Thanks." he mumbled while fixing his briefs.

"Be sure to eat up, you've got a big day ahead of you." Ash smiled at that, glad that her mood seemed to be getting friendlier.

Misty, however, glanced at his stretched out briefs and made a mental not to herself that they'd have to get him some more later.

Later, at the Pewter City Gym


Brock had enjoyed a wonderful breakfast that he had whipped up and had just finished checking on the sprinklers in the gym. Never know when you're gonna need them. he thought (okay, so I'm still not over that, whatever).

Just then he saw the doors to the gym being pushed open, and in walked what looked to be two trainers a couple of years younger than him accompanied by a Pikachu and a Poliwag. "I'm Brock." he said while giving a polite wave. "I take it at least one of you is here to challenge the Pewtwer City gym?"

The boy stepped forward, answering with a yes and identifying himself as Ash. Brock couldn't put his finger on it, but something about this kid looked like he could be full of surprises.

Anyways, the two got set to battle with Brock choosing out Geodude and Ash starting with his pidgeotto.

Misty stopped and smiled. She had been wondering when he would finally ask that, and while she had no intention of letting him be seen, she saw this as a great opportunity to have some more fun with him. "i said I'd give them back JUST before we reached the city. We can still get closer." Let's see if he takes the bait

Ash's face fell at her words. "B-but we're already so close! Wha-what if someone..." He blushed, his eyes starting to look around frantically.

Got him! she thought triumphantly. "Aw, worried someone'll catch you in your little tighty whities?" He gave an embarrassed nod, and his hands moved tdown in front of his groin in a futile attempt to cover himself as he felt as if someone might already be watching. "Well, I guess I could bend the rules just a little bit and give you back your clothes now," he started to sigh in relief, "if you're willing to get another spanking real quick."

If possible, his face reddened further. On one hand, more punishment for his already sore butt. On the other hand, the increased chance of his exposure become more public. yeah, that was worse. "Alright, deal."

"Great, now put you hands up against that tree and stick out you butt." doing as she said, he braced himself for the spanking that was to come. And come it did. For a full five minutes, her hands struck down on his backside, each hit reddening it further. Ash resorted to biting his bottom lip to avoid making any extra noise that might attract attention. Once his butt had turned a nice red color, she asked, "Having fun Ash?"

No, no he was not. Still, he gave a quiet yes. SMACK. "Mmmmhhmmm!"

"Yes what?"

No longer biting his lip, he answered, "Yes ma'am."

Smiling, Misty tossed his clothes onto him said, "Good boy. You've definitely got some endurance."

Ignoring that remark, Ash frantically put his clothes back on, at least until it came time to pull his pants up over his butt. He did that much more slowly.

With that settled, our group of trainers and Pokemon headed into town.

What next?

"...we'll be getting you some underoos once we get to town."

At those words, the wedgied boy's attempts at removing his briefs from his head stopped. "What?! Yo-you're joking? R-right? Right!" Ash hadn't worn underoos since he was seven. The switch over to plain tighty whities was made after an incident when Gary had decided to pants him at the playground. An action that earned plenty of laughter from everyone around. When Ash had later gotten home, he had begged his mom to buy him boxers in the hopes that it could reduce future humiliations. Some infinitely cooler boxers had been a deal breaker though. The slight improvement that was plain white briefs was the best his mother would agree to.

"Afraid not Ash. This is for your own good." Well, his own good and {{i}u}her own{/u} entertainment.

Frantic, the poor boy demanded to know, "How can this possibly be for my own good?!"

Sighing, Misty explained, "because Ash, you need more discipline. You couldn't even sleep in your wedgie when the point was to learn what your Caterpie felt like after you sent it to fight that Pidgeotto."

The reminder of that mistake caused Ash to suddenly find an interest in looking down at his feet, an action that made him wince slightly as his head pulled his briefs just a bit tighter. "I-I, know but, why-"

"Simple: since the threat of losing your pants wasn't enough, I'm just going to have to up the consequences for bad behavior." Suppressing her delighted smirk, she added, "In this case, upping your embarrassment. Now get your tighty whities off your head and start packing, we've got places to go and underoos to buy."

Doing as she said, and changing into a pair of less stretched briefs once she looked away, Ash began to think over his current options while packing. On one hand, he could suck it up, go back to wearing underoos, and pray that no one other than Misty ever saw him in them. Even limiting it just her though was mortifying. It would be embarrassing enough with another guy seeing him like that, but a GIRL! Maybe I could talk her into a lighter punishment. he thought. Of course, she may just see that as a sign that he's trying to run away from the consequences of his action. Even if he was starting to think she was a little crazy, he didn't want to risk making her too disappointed in him and think he wasn't worth teaching.

What to do, what to do?

11 minutes later...

Misty was looking around her area when she heard Ash say, "Hey Misty, check this out." Turning around she was dumbfounded to see a Vaporeon swimming around Ash.

"Huh, uh, what?" she asked, noticing a grin on Ash's face.

"I saw her by the edge of the water and swam over to her carefully. She kinda just looked at me like she was confused and moved closer, then I gave her a little pat on the head. Now this." he explained while pointing at the water-type swimming around him. "is this normal, or...?" In spite of his happiness at the situation, he did seem genuinely confused.

"Well, Vaporeon's are usually in urban areas, not the wild. Although the best place to see one in the wild would be a lake as perfect looking as this one." Misty answered, still sounding confused and uncertain as to why this one was following Ash.

Ash thought for a moment before saying, "Well, if they're usually urban, then do you think that means she wants to go into town or something?" Thinking again, he looked at the Vaporeon and asked, "Are you bored here?"

She gave a nod and a quick "vay" in answer.

Ash's smile widened, "So do you wanna come with us?"

She gave another "vay" and what seemed to be a shrug in response.

Misty just stared in bewilderment. A bored, wild Vapereon. I mean, I guess it could happen.

Ash, however, was thrilled. "Alright! Looks like I've got a new friend!"

121211112222211211121111212111.content:
A/N: Narrating combat is not my forte, but I'll give at least some sort of description.

Ash and Brock stood across from each other, ready to battle. Their brief introduction had been quite pleasant, and Brock was looking forward to seeing what his opponent had in store for him. He wasn't sure what, but something told him that there was something special about this kid.

The first round saw Ash's Pidgeotto go up against Brock's Geodude. Pidgeotto, following Ash's commands, staid up high and moved quickly to avoid any attacks that Geodude sent up. Although sending out attacks that could do enough damage proved to be a bit more difficult, as Geodude seemed able to weather every Gust of wind sent at him, and moving in close for Peck quickly became too risky after the first two attempts. In a surprising turn of events though, Ash managed to wrap up the fight when Pidgeotto, rather than Gust, ended up sending out a Twister attack, knocking the rock type over and out.

The second round proved to be a bit surprising against Onix's endurance when faced against Vaporeon. The stone snake held up against the first water gun sent at it and immediately put Vaporeon on the defensive as it was forced to dodge. Ash had Vaporeon dodging left and right, and even using quick attack to rush away from an Iron Tail. It took several more well timed water gun attacks amidst frantic dodges to finally bring the mighty beast down.

And just like that, Ash had earned his first gym badge.

As Misty and Ash were preparing to leave the gym, Brock stopped to congratulate the younger trainer again. "...and I've gotta say, your Vaporeon, moves surprisingly fast. How did you get her to be that quick?"

Ash rubbed the back of his neck and laughed awkwardly. "Honestly, I think that's all her. I haven't really had the chance to train her for speed yet."

Brock nodded. "Well, Pokemon can get a lot stronger on their own than we sometimes give them credit for."

"Yeah, sometimes it's less about training Pokemon to be stronger and more about figuring out what they can already do and what the best way to do it is." Misty added.

Ash took in this information, knowing that it would be useful later on.

What happens next?

The two trainer had agreed to stop by here to make sure that the two champions of the day were still doing well.

"That's great." said Ash. "that means we should be able to get moving again tomorrow." With that wrapped up, the two of them headed out of the Pokemon Center. "So Misty, what should be do now?"

His mentor smiled, already knowing exactly what she wanted to do. "Well, I remember seeing a bakery around here earlier. We could pick up a cake, head back to our room, and celebrate your win."

Ash beamed. That idea sounded perfect.

38 minutes later...

The pair were happily chatting about the battle as they entered their room, Ash carrying a vanilla cake. "That was sharp thinking using quick attack to dodge. Moves like that will definitely help you out." Misty said as she locked the door behind them while Ash set the cake down on a table.

"Yeah, but I couldn't have managed without your help." he said.

"Yeah, bu-" Misty paused as she looked at Ash.

"Confused by her abrupt silence, he asked, "Something wrong."

He felt a chill go down his spine as he saw the look in her eye. "Yes, actually. I can't see those adorable tighty whities of yours right now. Fix that."

Ash blushed in embarrassment, unable to believe what he had just heard. "Wh-what?!"

Misty just folded her arms. "I've told you already that you look better in your underwear. And since we're the only ones in this room, there's no reason for you not to be more... mmm exposed."

Ash's mouth opened and closed, trying to process what was happening. "Th-that doesn't mean I should jus-"

"Ash." she said firmly. "Take. Off. Your pants."
1212111122222112111211112121111.title: Misty plans to help Ash "celebrate" his...

choices: The next morning... The investigation begins!
12121111222221121112111121211111.content:
Ash's face turned red with deep embarrassment, and immediately undid his jeans, letting them drop to the floor.

Why did he do that you ask?

Well, would YOU want to have her do it herself? Especially considering how unusually strong Misty was for a girl her age and build?

Yeah, didn't think so...

Misty looked him over, then showed Ash a mirror. And now that he thought about it, he did kinda see where Misty was coming from... Not that he'd admit it aloud of course... So he decided to change the subject.

"Say uh... While we were on the way the gym, you looked like you were thinking about something... Was it that guy that was selling rocks?"

"Sort of..." Misty shrugged her shoulders; "There was something about him that felt familiar, I just don't know why... Plus, I find it kinda weird how he seemed to know about Brock... More than a salesman should anyway."

"Maybe we could ask?" Ash asked; " I mean, someone's bound to know something..."

Misty beamed at the statement as she brought the boy over into a headlock and gave him a friendly noogie the way only a tomboy could; "I knew there was a brain underneath all that hair!"

"Ack quit it!" Ash exclaimed half-heartedly with a grin, unable to escape the taller girl's hold as she rubbed her knuckles against his scalp.

Pikachu only grinned at the way his trainer and the girl were interacting, and shook his head in amusement as it escalated to a wrestling match...

A match where Misty held the advantage, thanks to her leverage and grip on Ash's undies.
12121111222221121112111121211111.title: Embarassed, Ash complies.

choices: "...go back to where we saw him?"
121211112222211211121111212111111.content:
The two of them had a fight night celebrating Ash's first win, although it could be said that Misty was having infinitely more fun playing with Ash than he would have liked. Once they had gotten his Pokemon back later, they had gone to bed, with Ash having been stripped down to just his undies. Although, come morning, Misty wasn't quite ready to stop the "celebration" just yet.

"Come on Ash." said Misty as she yanked on his briefs while still keeping him pinned down his bed. "Say it!"

"Ow! Misty's the queen of the universe!" he shouted while squirming beneath her and trying in vain to wiggle free from her pin.

"And what else?" she demanded, pulling harder and stretching out his briefs even further.

"AHHHhh! Come oHHHn! Don't make me- OW!"Misty doubled her efforts, grabbing the legholes and quickly stretching his briefs even further up his back as they made their way to his shoulder. Submitting, Ash cried out, "And I look so much better without pants, cause it lets people see my cute little underpants!" The boy's face was now completely red.

"And that..." Misty said as she finally released her hold on his briefs, letting the waistband snap against Ash's rear; "Is why starting now, whenever we're safely hidden behind closed doors, you will immediately take off your pants. Got it?"

"Yes ma'am." Ash answered reluctantly. Guess I should just be glad she didn't say that i couldn't wear a shirt either.

"Great!" she said, "Now we can start looking for information on that rock salesman as soon as you get dressed."

Aster digging his underwear out of his backside, Ash put on his clothes and the two trainers stepped out the door. "So where should we start? We might seem a little weird if we just go around asking about a random rock salesman."

"Hmmmm..." Misty briefly thought on where they could begin, and then decided on the most logical choice. "Why don't we..."
121211112222211211121111212111111.title: The next morning... The investigation begins!

choices: The trio arrive at their destination
1212111122222112111211112121111112.content:
"He does have a right to know, after all..." Misty said.

"True..." Ash said.
-

Later, the two made their way back to the gym, where they met up Brock while he was interacting with his nine younger siblings.

What was more surprising, of course, was that Brock was in fact the son of the previous gym leader, Flint Slate, who disappeared under mysterious circumstances. And with both parents out of the picture, it was up to Brock, not only to keep the gym running, but to also act as the man of the house (at the age of 15); providing the best that he could for his family.

Aside from this, Misty and Ash also made sure to tell him about the salesman.

"How could this guy know about me?" Brock asked. "This sounds pretty suspicious..."

"I know, we feel the same way." Ash said.

"We'll help you find the guy if you want!" Misty said; "Maybe after you two meet, we'll get the answer we need..."
--

After the duo, accompanied by Brock, searched for a while, they finally found the salesman, who was just getting back from the woods. Brock calmly, yet firmly asked the bearded man who he was, how and why he knew about Brock, and what have you.

The bearded man stood there in silence, almost as if he was thinking of what to say to get out of this conversation... Until the three gasped when the man removed his beard and hat, to reveal that he looked almost EXACTLY like Brock, save for being much older, and bigger.

I KNEW there was something familiar about him! Misty thought to herself.

"Dad?!" Brock said; "What? I... Where the hell have you been all this time?! Do you have any idea what I've been through since you were gone?! O-or how much my brothers and sisters felt when you went away?!

"Brock, I.... When I failed to become a successful trainer... I couldn't face you all. If I couldn't be good enough to use something other rock type Pokemon.... Than what good could I be as the man you and your siblings look up to?"

Brock's fists clenched; "So you left because you thought we'd all be better off without you?! Well guess what?... That's the biggest load of bullshit I've ever heard! If we really were better off, than we wouldn't be asking ourselves when you'd come home! It doesn't matter whether or not you'd be good enough as a trainer! What mattered to us has always been you being there for us! As a father should! This gym and everyone living in it needs you! I don't care how little you think of yourself, I won't let you walk away from your own family again! Not when they need you most!"

Misty, Pikachu, and Ash stood there, their mouths agape as they listened to Brock chewing out Flint.

"Son..." Flint struggled to find something to say, until tears rolled down his cheeks as he looked at his eldest son; "I don't see how you could still need me, even after my failure. Even after I hurt you and the other kids.... I'm not just a failure as a trainer... I've failed you as a father."

"I think you haven't looked hard enough..." Brock said, now with a more visibly relaxed posture. "Maybe you failed as a trainer, but you still have a chance as a father. If you really want to make up for everything we went through. Just... Please come home..."

"...All right..."
---

The reunion between Brock's siblings and their father was, suffice to say, emotional.

Flint apologized to everyone for leaving, promising to never leave the way he did again, with conviction in every syllable of his words. And everything settled down, he talked to Brock again.

"Son, I want to thank you and those kids for helping me snap out of my foolishness... You're growing to be a good, strong man. Which is why, I want you to do what I never did..."

"Dad, are you saying--"

"Yes Brock..." Flint said sternly; "I still recall that you have a dream as a Pokemon breeder.. And if you want to achieve it, than get out there and show what you're worth. You can't do that by staying here, because to deny you of your passion would be wrong. Besides... I think those kids could use your level-headedness."

Brock looked at him with disbelief, but gave a small smile; "I'll do it...."

Flint gave a smile of his own as he put a hand on his boy's shoulder; "Good... I have a feeling, you're going be something great."
---

Brock met up with Ash and Misty, who were playing with Brock's younger siblings until they saw him.

After Brock told them about his talk with Flint, the two looked at each other with a surprised look on their face, than at the young gym leader.

"You know, now that we've thought about it, I think we have room for our little group." Misty said.

"Pika!" Pikachu said as he leapt onto Ash's shoulders

"You said it buddy!" Ash said to his Pokemon, scratching him behind the ears.
--

And so, the duo had become a trio, as Brock, Misty, and Ash made their way from Pewter city to the next one.
1212111122222112111211112121111112.title: "...go and ask Brock about him?"

choices: She'll agree to talk, but she wants to wedgie him while she does in their room.
12121111222221121112111121211111121.content:
Our newly formed trio was making surprisingly good time on their way to Cerulean City. Surprising, because Misty seemed to want to slow the group down as much as she could along the way with a variety of weird excuses. like needing to stop and look for her missing spare hairband. You know, the one that didn't exist.

At first, Ash had enjoyed this change, as it caused her to be too distracted to find time to wedgie him. However, he was starting to grow concerned for his mentor.

This reached its head when the group finally reached the city, about and hour or two before sunset, and Brock saw Misty trying to sneak away to the left. "Hey, where are you heading to?" he asked, confused.

Misty froze up for a second as she tried to think up an excuse. "Uh, I'm just heading to, oh uh, do some shopping." She seemed to be racking her brains to explain this. "Because, uh, I'm, a girl. So, shopping."

Ash is someone who can be considered to be rather dense at times. But given the time he had spent with Misty so far, he could tell just as well as anyone else that everything she just said was nonsense, considering the tomboy hadn't even given a small hint she was into such things.'

"look," she said," I'm gonna go do... that. Why don't you guys find us a place to stay in the meantime. Just remember, since I'm Ash's mentor, we have to share a room." After a brief bit of thought, and realizing how that might sound, she added, "And JUST a room. We still get separate beds."

Confused and unsure how to respond, the two boys just gave an unsure "ooookayyyy" in response, and then she started walking off.

Making sure that his worries weren't totally founded, Ash turned to Brock and said, "Okay, was it me, or was that the most bizarre moment she's had yet?"

Brock nodded. "Normally I wouldn't want to pry, but that did seem way too weird. Maybe you should go check on her while I get the rooms."

Ash considered that for a moment before turning to his Pikachu on his shoulder. "Pikachu, do you think I should go talk to her." he got a frantic nod and a "Pika Pi" in response. "Okay then, I'll go over and do that." His course of action set, he started following after her. "I hope this goes well."

So how does it go?
12121111222221121112111121211111121.title: What's up with Misty lately?

choices: They eventually, arrive at the gym, where Ash meets Misty's sisters
121211112222211211121111212111111211.content:
Later
---

Ash let Pikachu proceed with his checkup while he walked into the room Misty was in, sitting on a bed with her shoes off while she hugged her legs.

"Mist? You feeling okay?" Ash asked as he walked in, closing the door behind him.

"I'm fine Ash... Just go and prepare for your gym battle!" Misty said.

"You didn't sound fine then, and you don't now!" Ash said.

Something was definitely wrong, considering Misty didn't tell him to take his pants off; "If anything, you looked like you didn't want to go to the gym..."

"Well, I-"

"Misty, please talk to me! I wanna help with what's bugging you! You've been helping me so much, and now I want to return even a quarter of all you've done for me!"

Misty looked at the boy as he pleaded with her. After some thought, Misty got off the bed; "Do you really wannna know?..."

"I won't stop asking until you do..." Ash said.

"Okay..." Misty sighed; "But first things first, your undies..."

Ash nodded, turning around and lifting up his blue jacket so she could see the waistband of his briefs. It didn't take long for him to feel Misty's fingers grip them (though not before taking his hat off), nor for him to squeal in discomfort as the taller girl hoisted him off the floor.
---

Misty sat across from Ash on a separate bed, while the boy in question was sitting with the back of his underpants pulled over his eyes and hooked under his nose.

"All right... The reason I was against going to the gym is related to the reason I specialize in water Pokemon..." Misty's voice trembled with hesitation; "Um.... Ever heard of the Sensational Sisters?"

"Don't they put on those shows with water Pokemon?' Ash said as he winced a bit from the way his cotton dug into his crack..

"Yeah, but they're also in charge of the Cerulean gym..." Misty said; "Which is why I have water pokemon... They're my older sisters..."

Ash's jaw dropped.

"See... My relationship with them is strained.... For a lack of a better word. Doesn't exactly help that a couple of people have compared me to them. They're oh so graceful and beautiful, whereas I'm the tomboy that wields a mallet and has a thing for yanking on peoples' skivies. Which is why I decided to run away and strike out on my own..." Misty sighed.

"Mist... I... Never realized that you've gone through that..." Ash said, his demeanor softening. ".... You know what? The people that compare you with your sisters... They clearly haven't stopped to get to know you like I've been... First, you're an awesome water Pokemon trainer, probably even way better than your sisters! Second... You've been helping me grow as a trainer for the last few days. I don't know how I could've gone so far without your guidance! Heck, I'm surprised you saw anything worthwhile in me..."

And not that Ash would say it, but he actually was growing fond of Misty's tomboyish attitude.

Misty smiled as she walked over and got Ash's underwear off his head, proceeding to then pull him up into a hug; "You have no idea how much I needed to hear that..."'
121211112222211211121111212111111211.title: She'll agree to talk, but she wants to wedg...

1212111122222112111211112121111112111.content:
Meeting Misty's sisters was, in a word, crazy. Oh getting to them was no problem. The actual problem was, eh, well...

"You're seriously just handing over the badge?!" Ash and Brock had cautiously backed away as the words exploded from Misty.

Her sisters, however, seemed to be completely unperturbed. Although I have no idea how? Ash thought.

"Sister dear," began Violet, "it's not like that would be much different from trying to battle right now."

"Yes," chimed in Daisy, "even if we did have a couple more Pokemon to go with Goldeen, that Pikachu of his alone would practically guarantee him the win."

"We don't expect you to understand, of course." Lily added. "Running a gym is exhausting. Why do you think we're backstroking away from it?"

Misty was practically grinding her teeth. "Grrrr!" I know my sisters aren't exactly ideal, but there's that, and there's nonsense like this! Seriously, just giving away a badge!

"Should we do something?" Ash whispered to Brock.

"Remember earlier when I told you it's okay to sometimes?" he whispered back. Ash nodded. "This isn't one of those times." Ash wasn't going to argue with that.

Lily, meanwhile, was smugly wrapping up her point. "Now unless you know of some other way to settle this, I suggest you just let your little boyfriend take the badge already."

"Speaking of little..." Violet as she looked at Ash; "He's a bit of a runt, Mist... Don't you like, want someone taller?"

Ash looked a bit miffed at the jabs to his height.

"He's not- grdiruh..." her words quickly turned into completely unintelligible grumbling. She took a deep breath, an idea for what to do forming in her head. ",,,Dah, Ash!" The boy jumped as his redheaded companion shouted his name.

"Uh, yeah." he replied swiftly.

"You agree that you should have to battle for the badge, right?!"

"Uh, well, yeah. I mean it would be kinda disappointing. I'd rather actually earn it. But, well..." he sheepishly gestured to her sisters. "I'm all for it if you've got another idea though."

As a matter of fact, she did. She was just taking a moment to wonder if she should actually do it. On one hand, having him battle her for it would give him the perfect chance to actually earn the badge and let her prove her skills to her sister. I'd definitely do a lot better than they would. But at the same time, she was tempted to just not. After all, she'd hardly be making her point if she lost, and she wouldn't want Ash to lose the battle either. Besides, my sisters aren't really setting a very high bar for me to live up to right now. And as for earning the badge, well, the wedgie session I'm going to give him tonight should do.

What does Misty decide?

Option 2: Let Ash take the badge. At this point, she's pretty sure that he would have crushed her sisters anyway and he can prove himself worthy of the badge tonight when she gets her hands on his undies again.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111.title: They eventually arrive at the gym.

choices: Ash shows Misty what he's learned
12121111222221121112111121211111121111.content:
It was then that Misty decided.

"Okay here's what I've decided.. Instead of battling my sisters.." Misty turned to Ash and pointed a thumb at herself; "You'll be battling me!"

Ash looked at her with a dumbfounded yet nervous look , his knees shaking at the mere thought. Misty saw how he reacted, and realized that it was because of the two advantages she had over him.

First of all, Misty was a much more skilled battler than Ash was, along with having more experience than he did. Heck, the only reason he did so well at Pewter gym was because Brock, despite being more experienced than he was, didn't expect Ash to be as skilled as he was.

Second, she was still his coach/mentor. Considering they'd been traveling for a while, she'd know how he thinks in a Pokemon battle, especially since she was the one helping him with his battling skills.

In other words, there was a possibility that she'd crush him in an all out Pokemon battle.

"However..." Misty said with reassurance in her voice; "For this battle, it'll be different from a regular gym battle.. The point of our battle won't be for you to beat me. It'll be to test your skill, and how well you apply it. If I think you've proven your skill well enough, the match ends with you winning the badge!"

Ash relaxed a bit more, but was still nervous regardless.

Misty's sisters, and Brock, looked at her with astonishment, but ultimately didn't object.
--

Everyone went to the pool, where everything was getting set up for the battle.

Before Ash went to his side of the pool, Violet walked up to him a bit sneakily. Proceeding to give him a bit of a tug on his tighty whities up to his lower back before letting them snap back into his jeans.

"Hey!" Ash stiffened up as he turned to face Violet; "What was that-"

"Relax shortstuff. First, that was for luck... Second, I just wanted to see why Misty gives these so much. Gotta say, the reaction on your face was priceless!" she cackled a bit as she skipped merrily away from the boy as Ash stuffed his briefs back into his jeans, grumbling to himself until he finished and went to the pool.

Soon enough, Misty stood across on the other side of the pool from Ash, who appeared to be doing his best to ignore the voice in his head as she instructed him back in Pewter.

"This match will allow only two Pokemon each! If the challenger shows enough skill that Misty deems satisfactory, then he will earn the Cerulean gym badge! Let the battle.... BEGIN!"
12121111222221121112111121211111121111.title: She'll battle Ash.

121211112222211211121111212111111211111.content:
While nervous to be battling his mentor, even if he wasn't expected to win, Ash did know that he had at least one advantage. While he wasn't exactly the practically guaranteed win that Misty's sisters had called him, Pikachu's electric power would give him a good leg up and head start in the fight. "Alright, Pikachu, I choose you!" he called out with his arm outstretched as Pikachu... wasn't there. "Huh?"

"Pika." the electric mouse popped up from behind his left shoulder.

Ash smiled as he saw his small friend. "Oh, there you are." Well, now let's-"

"Pika Pi."

"Uh, is something wrong?" Ash was rather confused, and hoping that nothing bad had suddenly happened to Pikachu. Said Pokemon began explaining, by which I mean saying its name in different tones and gesturing about randomly, the issue. "Soooo, you're saying you don't wanna fight Misty because she's our friend?"

"Pika." A nod.

Misty stared in bewilderment, wondering how this kid seemed to attract so many odd Pokemon. It was only a bit strange when Pikachu seemed to absolutely HATE the idea of going into a Pokeball, but now there's this. Not to mention that whole thing with Vaporeon.

The redhead was about to say something, only to be cut off by Ash, "So can you tell me why?" he asked his Pikachu calmly."

He got a few more gestures and and bit of Pokemon speech in response.

"So, you're worried about hurting her Pokemon?" He got a nod in response and, much to Misty's surprise, smiled. "You are really are nice little guy, aren't ya?" Pikachu smiled a bit and nodded while awkwardly scratching its head with its tail. "Still, you don't have to worry about that." he said while petting Pikachu a bit." Just think o f this as a spar, not a fight. Friends do that all the time." Pikachu seemed to be mulling that over for a moment before Ash said one more thing that he new would spur Pikachu on to fight. "Besides, I'd be a little more worried about them hurting you, buddy."

Shock briefly took over Pikachu's face as he let out a confused "Pika?"

"Well yeah, I know you're an electric type and all, but Misty's water Pokemon are WAY more experienced." Misty smiled fro mwhere she was standing as she heard Ash say this. "I'm just not so sure you'd be up to the challenge."

"Pika! Pikachu! Pika Pi. Pikachu!" the small mouse said fiercely and with confidence while gesturing towards Misty, himself, and then Ash.

"You sure?" ash asked. Receiving a particularly loud "PIKA" in response. "Alright then, let's see what you've got!" Ash said as Pikachu moved forward, ready to battle.

Misty smiled, proud of how Ash handled the situation with his Pikachu. You're definitely getting better Ash. Although, now I really wish I had gotten you those Pikachu underoos back in Pewter City. Oh well, I'll just be sure to pull your undies extra hard tonight.
121211112222211211121111212111111211111.title: Ash shows Misty what he's learned

1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
"All right... NOW, we can begin!" Daisy said, with annoyance from the interruption.
---

As soon as the announcement was made, Misty brought out a pokeball, pressing the button to enlarge it. She gave Ash a stern look that told him that he better be ready, making sure that he understood the importance of this gym battle.

"Misty calls.... Seel!"

And just like that, a white light flashed out of the opened pokeball and onto a platform until it stopped, revealing the seal-like Pokemon.

Wasting no time, Ash immediately started off by attempting the first attack, ordering Pikachu to launch a thunderbolt.

Just as Pikachu launched it, however, Seel already dived into the pool, avoiding the electric attack.

Both the trainer and his electric mouse gaped at the pinniped Pokemon's reflexes. But both snapped out of it, just in time for Pikachu to quickly duck under a headbutt from Seel, which had such speed and power that Pikachu's fur could feel a breeze blow against it.

As soon as Seel splashed back into the water, Pikachu scampered to the next platform on his right.

Only for Seel to stealthily climb onto the platform Pikachu was on and toss him into the air with his head (thankfully not using his horn), and immediately slapped him away with his tail.

Pikachu naturally launched a thunderbolt in mid-air as retaliation, which hit right on point. Pikachu then landed on a platform in a quadrupedal stance, as nimbly as a cat would.

Misty had Seel use aqua ring to recover from the electric attack to a degree.

Retaliating immediately, after getting hit. Even used Seel's slap to gain some distance... Not bad! Misty thought to herself; But now, it's time to stop prodding...
