Soon, Seel dove into the water again and launched a water pulse at Pikachu, who leapt over it. Not wanting to give Pikachu time to retaliate again, Seel chased after him while lobbing water pulse after water pulse.Thankfully, Pikachu was ordered to use agility to better avoid the watery spheres. But even still, Seel was keeping Pikachu from using his electric attacks.

Ash was sweating bullets, as he could only watch as Pikachu was being chased around the pool, unable to send out a single thunderbolt as he scampered onto platform after platform.

Then of course, Misty grew tired of this impromptu game of "ring-around-the-rosie" and had Seel use blizzard on one of the platforms Pikachu was about to leap on. The sea lion Pokemon obeyed and leapt out of the water, blowing a gust of chilled air from his mouth onto the surface of the platform and creating a sheet of ice. Pikachu couldn't stop himself from landing on it in time, unfortunately.

Because Pikachu was struggling to get his footing back, Seel was given ample time to slam his larger body against Pikachu, sending him flying across the pool. Seel dove into the water and swam quickly, managing to leap into the air and intercepted Pikachu by spiking him into the water with his tail.

It was now or never! if Ash didn't think of something now, Pikachu wouldn't be able to get even a single attack in before getting knocked out.

That is, until a lightbulb flashed into his head.

"Pikachu, wait for my signal!" Ash said.

"Pi-i chuuu Pikapi, Pi pikaa Kaa..."

[Translation: All right Ash, I trust you...]

And so Pikachu waited as Seel swam at him like a torpedo, getting closer and closer... Until...

"Now, use thunderbolt while still in the pool!" Ash said.

Misty couldn't order Seel to get out of the pool in time, as he was still charging. Even though his headbutt connected solidly and sent Pikachu flying, Pikachu was still able to send out currents of electricity throughout the water at the moment of impact, giving Seel a good shock.

Pikachu landed on a platform, almost like a ragdoll in contrast to his agile movements from before.

Seel, on the other hand (flipper?), just barely had enough strength to stay conscious and stay afloat, though the blubber coated on his his body did manage to slightly insulate him from the electricity, So regardless of his severely weakened state, he was still declared the winner, as Pikachu fainted.

"Man, who knew our little sister could kick so much butt in a Pokemon battle?" Lily said, her eyes widening with astonishment.

"She even got around the type advantage the squirt's Pikachu had!" Violet exclaimed.

Brock, of course, wasn't surprised in the slightest. Considering that Ash did the same thing during Pidgeotto's bout with Geodude, it was only natural that Misty could also do it; though to a greater degree, anyway.

Ash, leapt onto the platforms until he got to Pikachu, lifting the little guy into his arms. Pikachu regained consciousness, giving him a little thumbs up to show that he wasn't discouraged from getting beaten by a water Pokemon. Ash smiled while he carried him off of the pool.

"You were awesome out there, bud. Way I see it, you deserve a good long rest..."
--

After Pikachu was handed to Brock, Ash went back to the pool, and got out his pokeball. Thankfully, due getting severely shocked by pikachu's thunderbolt in the pool, Misty wasn't going to use Seel for the next round.

So now, it all came down to one Pokemon each...

Pidgeotto was somewhat out of the question, considering that despite having no weakness against water type moves, he still likely wouldn't fare well if his wings got too wet. Metapod's mobility was somewhat restricted, so he was a no go. This of course, left Ash with only one viable option.

"All right Vaporeon, let's show Misty what ya got!"

When Vaporeon came out of her pokeball and was on a platform, she looked around until she saw Ash and gave him a questioning look.

After Ash explained what was going on, Vaporeon nodded in understanding and turned around, ready for her first gym bout.

Misty opened a pokeball, calling out the occupant inside.

Ash swallowed a lump in his throat as he looked at Vaporeon's opponent, whom he had every right to be nervous of. Who was it you ask?

Why, a seaking, of course!

Despite not having the gyrados' fearsome reputation; any wildlife expert, Pokemon researcher, fisherman , and those that survive an attack would tell you that these horned fish are not to be taken lightly.

1.) Seakings are powerful swimmers. They can not only swim against a river's current, but they're even able to swim up a waterfall.

2.) That single horn on a seaking's head isn't for show; it's a deadly weapon that trainers must hope to never be on the receiving end of, due to it being powerful enough to bore holes through boulders.

Ash did his best to calm his nerves as he got himself ready.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Now the battle REALLY begins.

1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Ash knew that this battle was going to be difficult. Misty had the clear advantage. As such, he decided to be cautious, waiting for Misty to make the first. And move she did! "Seaking, Horn attack!"

The dangerous fish rushed forward straight toward Vaporeon, who, at Ash's command, dodged and fired a water gun the was easily avoided by Seaking. "Darn it." Ash muttered.

"You'll have to do better than that Ash. Now, Poison Jab!"

Fortunately for Ash, Vaporeon was just as quick to dodge this time as last. Even better, an idea was forming in the boy's mind.

"Water Gun." Misty called out.

"Dodge, and then circle around under Seaking."

"Huh?" Misty watched as Vaporeon dodged and swam under Seaking, coming out on the opposite of the fish. Deciding not to give Ash a moment to think, she called out, "Horn attack!" Playing defense won't work for long Ash.

Again Ash had Vapoeon dodge oddly, this time having her dive down and actually jump over Seaking's attack before calling out "Water Gun."

Again Seaking avoided the move, and Misty, getting a bit irritated by this battle turning into a game of Meowth and Ratata, yelled, "Seaking keep chasing Vaporeon and don't use Megahorn attack until you get close."

Seeing the opportunity he was waiting for yelled, "Dive, get him following you, then swim straight up as fast as you can!"

"Really, still running Ash?" she asked, honestly surprised. What is he up to?

She got her answer soon enough as the inevitable result of their commands happened. Vaporeon leapt up from the water, actually managing to go up a good four feet with how fast it was moving, with Seaking following behind with his horn glowing and, thanks to his superior speed, closing the distance fast. "Tail whip him straight upward!" Ash yelled out.

"What?" Misty watched as Vaporeon did an odd turn in the air before striking Seaking with her tail and, combined with the momentum it already had, knocked him straight up to the ceiling for a hard collision as Vaporeon landed back in the water.

"Keep him up there with water gun!" Vaporeon obeyed, knocking the fish back into the ceiling with the blast of water. Once Seaking started falling again, Ash called out for a tackle which Vaporeon managed to land on the now seriously dazed fish. It probably didn't help that Misty seemed just just as dazed with surprise.

Just as Vaporeon was about to retreat away, Misty gave a few claps, causing her to pause and Ash and the the others to stare at her. "Okay, i am officially impressed." Granted her Seaking definitely still looked battle ready, if a little beaten up. In fact, he looked like he wanted nothing more than to be given an attack command so that he could get some much deserved revenge for the embarrassment he just suffered.

"Uh, you are?" Ash asked.

"After a maneuver like that?" she asked rhetorically. "Yes, definitely yes." she said with pride. "Although i have no idea what would inspire you to weaponize the gym's ceiling like that." She laughed a bit as she said that last part.

Ash let out an elated cheer in response.

What happens next?

Option 1. After Ash gets the badge and Misty has a few words with her sisters, the group heads back to the inn, where Misty plans to have herself an all night wedgie session with Ash to celebrate. Oh boy.

Option 2: Some other thing. I'm only putting this option here because i feel like I should give more than 1 option.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Round two

choices: The next day, Misty's sisters say their farewells... And give Ash a parting gift
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
While Ash and Brock were playing with their Pokemon, with Ash having won the Cerulean gym badge, things were pretty cheerful.

Misty looked at Ash with a warm smile on her face, beyond glad to know that the boy was making progress as a trainer. And what's more? There was a twinkle in his eye that practically glowed with exuberance from having not just earned his badge, but from actually impressing his coach/mentor.

He still had a long way to go, but she had a feeling that the boy would be going places in the future. All he had to was to keep at it is all.

"Hey, uh, sis? Could we talk to you in private?" Violet asked as she tapped Misty's shoulder.

"Hmm?" Misty turned around and saw all three of her big sisters standing in front of her. "Sure, what about?"

"Something important..." Daisy said.
--

After the four sisters walked out of the room with the pool, the talk began.

"Soooo, after we watched your match with your boyfriend, we just gotta say something..." Lily,

Normally, Misty would've reminded her (or protest, whichever) that Ash wasn't her boyfriend, but she let it slide since this talk was so important.

"You showed some incredible skill at Pokemon battling out there Misty..." Daisy said; "I've never seen anyone take control of a battle the way you did. In the first round alone, you showed quick thinking, coordination with your Pokemon, and even got around an opponent's type advantage to a degree I hadn't seen before!"

"What's more? You showed a great judge in skill from seeing the way Ash battled. Heck, the kid's not too shabby of a battler himself, especially since he's learning under you. He's still a dork outside of that, but still!" Lily said with a giggle at the last part.

"How come you never told us you were this good?" Violet asked.

"Well, I... Um..." Misty hadn't predicted this at all. But thankfully, she regained her composure; "See, there've been people that compared me with you, to the point where I just had enough of it! I wasn't going to stop being a mallet wielding tomboy just to please them, so I decided to hone my battling skills in private so I could become a water pokemon master... That way, I could become more than what THEY wanted... Yeah, sounds sappy and stupid, but that's how I feel..."

Her sisters looked at her, their faces softening.

Daisy suddenly gently pulled her youngest sister into a hug; "I'm beyond sorry Misty... We never knew what you were going through!"

"We don't care if you're not into 'girly' stuff like us. Nor your mallet, strength, or thing with tugging underwear up someone's crack. We don't want anyone to try and dictate who you should be!" Violet joined in. "If anyone's got a problem, they can just get in line for a royal butt kicking from us!"

"You're our sister Mist..." Lily said as she joined. "We'll always love you for who YOU are, tomboy or otherwise! What matters most is that you stay true to your heart! And from the way I see it, Ash and Brock feel the way about you..."

Misty's eyes widened, as if time had stopped while her older sisters hugged her tenderly. Eventually, she gave a big smile and let tears of joy fall down as she hugged her sisters.
---

Later, at the inn in the evening, Ash and Misty were in their room, where the boy was just finished getting changed into a new pair of red briefs with blue zigzag patterns on them. He then came out, now clad in only the undies and nothing else towards Misty.

"Definitely made the right call with these..." Misty smirked as she gently tugged on the waistband, letting them snap back after releasing them. "What do you think, Ashy-boy?"

"They actually feel kinda nice, in all honesty..." Ash said, smiling as his cheeks turned pink.

"Good! Now, time to see if how long they last in my hands..." Misty said, giving a cat-like grin as she cracked her knuckles.

Without even needing to be ordered, Ash turned around and showed his butt to Misty. The tomboy than proceeded with ever so slowly grabbing the waistband with an underhand grip in preparation. Soon enough, Misty had hefted the young trainer off the floor in one clean jerk upwards towards the ceiling.

Ash squeaked as Misty suspended him by his briefs, the material digging into him. Strangely enough, he wasn't resistant to it as usual... Could it be that he was growing accustomed to them?

"Hey, uh, Mist?" Ash winced; "I still haven't thanked you... For making me a better trainer..."

"Give yourself some credit Ash..." Misty giggled; "You still put in 120% percent, that's bound to make help you in the long run!" Misty gave the smaller boy a little bounce, as a means of sinking the briefs deeper.
"Besides... By training you, I think I'm getting better myself..."

"Eep! So... We're basically helping each other?" Ash bit his lower lip from the material digging into him.

Misty paused as she thought about it...

"Yeah.... I guess you could say that..."
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Option 1.

choices: Misty takes Ash with her to pick up some extra briefs for him before they leave.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Ash smiled. It was nice knowing that their arrangement was helping her out so much.

Of course,Misty couldn't let a moment like this continue for long. "Alright, enough of the sappy stuff." she said while giving his briefs another sharp pull and making him squeak. "Let's see how much it will take to get you squirming."

"Ah! Oh god!" he gasped out as Misty spun him around a couple of times by his undies. "Probably less tha-EHHHNn you think!" Suddenly Misty stopped mid spin and stepped back while giving a strong pull, letting the momentum further pull on the boy's underwear. "YEOWWW!" With her strength, she then tossed him face first onto his bed.

"Well, that's good." she said walking up behind him and grabbing his waistband again. "It wouldn't be quite as much fun otherwise." Pulling up, she briefly lifted the boy off the be before dropping him back down as he whimpered, shaking just a little bit. "Ooh, shaking. Nice, it makes that little butt of yours look even cuter." As if to emphasize her point, she then gave him s strong swat on the aforementioned butt."

"Ah!. Th-thanks..." he said, uncertain and blushing like crazy. Oh man, how is this still so embarrassing? His embarrassment and worry grew when he felt her slide her left arm through the leg-holes of his briefs. "M-misty, what are you doing?"

"Isn't it obvious?"

Ash quickly found himself lifted completely off the bed, squealing as Misty curled and uncurled her arm

"I'm doing some weight-lifting."

The next day...

While Brock was getting a new map, as Misty had thrown the previous one into the campfire on the journey to the city during one of her attempts to stall, Ash and Misty were outside the Cerulien gym saying goodbye to Lily, Daisy, and Violet.

"It really was great seeing you again sis."

"Yeah, and we hope you have a great journey."

"And feel free to tell us about it the next time you're here."

Misty smiled. "Thanks you guys. And I will."

Suddenly, Violet turned towards Ash. "And Ash, we have a little goodbye present for you as well."

"Huh? What is it?" he asked.

"Close your eyes." she said. He did.

Suddenly, the boy felt four, yes four, sets of hands all grab his briefs and yank upward. "OWWWWWWHOWowow!"

Combined, and grabbing from all sides, Misty and her sisters managed to yank his briefs up to just below his chest in one go. And after some pulling, while he futilely struggled to get free, they managed to get his tighty whities up to the top of his chest. Thankfully, they did let go of him after that.

"See?" Violet began. "His face was hilarious."

"Never mind his face, his voice sounded... perfect." said Daisy.

"And the way he was thrashing around." added Lily. "All helpless, it was as adorable as it was funny. I think I see why you do this so much Misty. even if it is weird. Well, at least with your boyfriend here anyways. I guess that's why you picked him."

Hehe, well..." Misty smiled and rubbed the back of her head awkwardly. Then her mind finally processed the word "boyfriend" again and she seethed a bit internally.

Ash, meanwhile, held his groin with only one thought in his mind. a bunch of girls think I'd be good boyfriend material. And it has to be because of this! Well, that and his currently immense discomfort.

What will happen next?

Option 1: On their journey to the next town, while Brock puts some kind of meal together, Misty takes Ash away from the campsite to practice more with his Pokemon. What wedgie methods will she use this time?
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: The next day, Misty's sisters say their far...

choices: "Bulbasaur and the Hidden Village" - Wedgie edition
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
It's been at least a day or two since the trio started their trek from Cerulean, with Ash still feeling a bit of phantom pain from the super wedgie that Misty and her sisters had given him before they left.

Vermillion was still a town over or so, but despite the long journey, Ash wasn't discouraged in the slightest. It kept his companions in good spirits, who gladly welcomed his infectious optimism. Misty especially, considering that outside of the wedgies she gave the young trainer, she had also grown rather fond of him.

Brock was especially important for the two, considering his talents as a cook and his perchance for being the "big brother" of the group. Save for his occasional "girl-crazy mode", he was usually the one acting as the voice of reason in moments where It was needed. It helped that he seems to have more experience with surviving out in the wilderness, likely a result of his father's teachings as well as having to take his siblings camping on occasion.

Speaking of which... Brock was already at work cooking dinner.

When asked how long it'd take, he wagered it to be around at least three hour or so, given the preparation required for the recipe he was using.

Misty opted to go out training with Ash to pass the time training, with Pikachu staying behind to help guard the camp.
--

"All right Ash, I think for today, you should bring out Metapod" Misty said. "He could use the exercise... Though I don't know how he'd even be able to move around... Anyway, back on topic! Why don't you try and see if you can improve on the things he knows?..."

Ash nodded meekly, knowing there was no way for him to get out of it. He then proceeded with calling Metapod out of the pokeball.

The bug type jumped into the air a bit with joy, though how he could do this without legs is a mystery.

Anyway, training began with Ash having Metapod improve the accuracy of his string shot by firing globs of the sticky stuff at some leaves on a branch.
--

This continued for a little while now, with Misty having not made a move on him yet. What's more?

Sometime, after Ash and Metapod took a bit of a break. She seemed to have disappeared who knew how many minutes ago while Ash was doing target practice with his little green pal. Ash had no clue what was up, though he figured she went out to see if she could find a water Pokemon to catch...

The instant that Ash and Metapod got back into training, this time with tackle attack, they didn't even notice that someone was watching them from the trees. Someone wearing a camouflaged jumpsuit, along with a full face mask that completely concealed the face and hair; as well as gloves.

Silently but stealthily, the figure slowly crept up closer and closer, until they suddenly grabbed Ash from behind and yanked him backwards by his jacket.

"H-hey, what the heck?!"

Metapod immediately rushed to his trainer's defense and tackled the person away, only to get pushed away as retaliation and landed on his side.

Ash immediately returned Metapod' to his pokeball. While Metapod didn't look like he was hurt, he didn't want to risk his Pokemon getting injured for his sake needlessly. This turned out to be a big mistake, as the mysterious newcomer looked at him, and slowly walked towards him.

Gulping with fright, Ash slowly walked backwards. Further and further he kept his distance from the figure until he turned tail and ran, with his pursuer doing their best to make sure he didn't get away.

The chase lasted about two minutes, with Ash sweating nervously as he tried unsuccessfully to shake them off while running through various shrubbery. All this came to a close when he tried to dart to the side, only for him to be tackled to the ground by the taller figure,

After a brief struggle, the figure grabbed him by the best on his jeans and brought him to his feet as they stood up.

Ash suddenly found himself in an over the shoulder carry, much to his annoyance as he vocally protested his being taken against his will... Only for the figure to suddenly walk to a rock formation with a particularly curved shape stone on the side. They then reached a free hand into his jeans and fished around until they proceeded to hook Ash's blue briefs with green swirl design patterns not the stone, hefting him off their shoulder and letting him dangle from the stone.

The boy yelped as gravity went to work on him, but then admits his struggling, he heard the figure give a familiar laughter. They then proceeded to pull their mask off to reveal...

"Misty?!"

"Ta-da!"

Ash squirmed around as he hung by his undies; "W-what the heck is-"

"It's part of the training... Basically, I pretend to be someone who wants to kidnap you and you attempt to escape. But you returned Metapod to his pokeball when he was still very well capable of defending you."
She placed her hands on her hips and shook her head; "Plus, you know very well he can use harden... So, mind telling me why you made such a bone headed move?!"

"I-I...... I didn't want to risk Metapod getting seriously hurt because of me... I... I don't think I can deal with something like that, not like when Pikachu risked himself to stop the spearrow from nearly killing me! I...... I don't want that to ever happen again!"

Misty looked up at him with sympathy, proceeding to get him down from the rock formation. While Ash was digging his underwear out of is bum, Misty put both hands gently on Ash's shoulders.

"Ash... I..... Look, I know how much you care about every single one of your Pokemon. But you gotta realize that, they care just as much about you as you do them; because you've shown them nothing but love, affection, and encouragement. That to them, is what makes YOU so valuable in the first place!" Misty said; "If they want to protect you, than they'll do it, regardless of the risks. It's not something that you can stop Ash... Any more than you can catch lightning in a bottle.."

In the time that Ash was given to mull over these words, the two heard a rustling that came closer, louder, until a wild and rather grouchy pinsir came into view.

Apparently, the bug type Pokemon wasn't a big fan of he idea of humans being in his territory. Just as Misty was about to send out a water Pokemon, however, Metapod popped out of his pokeball and attempted to the tackle, only to get smacked away for his troubles.

Metapod thankfully used harden to avoid the impact from slamming into a tree. But the pinsir seemed intent on using his horns to do him in, so naturally, Ash attempted to distract him by throwing a stone.Just as the pinsir turned to face him, Metapod suddenly glowed, with his shell opening up to reveal-

"Butterfree, the Butterfly Pokémon. Butterfree is the evolved form of Metapod. Its wings, covered with poisonous powders, repel water. This allows it to fly in the rain" Dexter's electronic voice resounded.

Ash and Misty couldn't believe what they saw before them, as Butterfree flew in front of Ash and Misty protectively. Just as the pinsir charged, however, Butterfree suddenly used string shot to immobilize him.
Just as the stag beetle Pokemon had gotten loose, Butterfree than flapped his wings and used sleep powder to naturally put him to sleep.

Butterfree floated over to Ash, nuzzling him affectionately.

Ash smiled big time as he pat his Pokemon on the head.

"Brock is not gonna believe this..." Misty murmured to herself...
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Option 1

choices: ..., likely unintentionally, leave Ash in a wedgie.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Our heroes were having a... well, in all honesty, it wasn't that weird a day all things considered. Yes, a Bulbasaur coming out of no where to protect an Oddish from being caught wasn't exactly normal, but was pretty tame when compared to a lot of things that travelers can come across. In fact, this bridge was probably weirder than that.

"It's odd, I don't see this anywhere on the map." Brock said, studying and turning around the map in his hands.

"Yeah, and why is it a rope bridge?" Ash asked. That got him a couple of confused stares.

"Uhhh, what?" Asked Brock.

"It's a bridge over rushing rapids and big rocks." The boy explained, stating the obvious. "You'd think whoever built it would make something sturdier and less likely to get taken down by a strong wind." Brock and Misty thought for a moment before nodding in agreement.

Of course, that also prompted worry from Misty. "Brock, do you see any other paths over this thing on the map?"

"I don't even see this one on here." he answered. "Huh, the bridge must be new or something."

Looking over the bridge, Ash briefly weighed their chances of getting across. What's the worst that could happen?

42 and a half seconds later...

"Ooookay, irrr, and... I'm up!" Misty grunted out as she climbed off of Ash and onto steady ground on the other side of the now wrecked bridge."

"Great. How 'bout giving me a hand?" Ash asked, still hanging to the wrecked bridge and trying to pull himself the rest of the way.

"Right." Misty said, crouching down and reaching her right hand towards his left... and then past it towards his butt.

"Oh come o-owhowhowhowoW!" Ash shouted as Misty grabbed the exposed waistband of his briefs and hoisted him the rest of the way up by those. "Ow! is this really the-Yeowch! Sorry, sorry!" he backpedaled his complaining as she started bouncing him.

"It's always a good time for a wedgie Ash."

With that settled, the two soon moved on to figuring out where the water had likely carried Brock to. unfortunately, they would be setting off a few traps along the way. Traps that would somehow...
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: "Bulbasaur and the Hidden Village"  Wedgie edition

choices: The mysterious girl introduces herself, and the hidden secret she protects.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Misty, Ash, and Pikachu walked on as they searched for Brock. So far, they had been walking for at least half an hour, with next to no clues found at the moment.

To make matters worse, things had gotten just a tad too quiet around here.

"Misty.... Do you think whoever put up that bridge wanted to...? You know.." Ash drew his index finger across his throat.

"Probably... Though not out of malice..." Misty' foot unknowingly stepped on something hidden underneath a couple of leaves; "Probably wanted to-OH CRAP!!"

Misty immediately grabbed Ash and pulled him down with her to the grass, ducking just in time to avoid getting slammed into by a log on a rope.

Their eyes bugged out of surprise and fear, thanking their lucky stars and reflexes for avoiding such a collision.

"Ash, I think we better keep moving" Misty asked herself as she and Ash got to their feet and made a run for it.
--

The trio dodged rocks thrown at them, narrowly avoided a pit, and other such obstacles... The next one was a tad more embarrassing, however...

As soon as Ash had stepped on another hidden trigger, he narrowly avoided getting slammed by another log, though the seat of his pants, unfortunately, got caught on a branch as it flew by. The log naturally dragged the screaming boy along, who was now, unfortunately, hanging by his jeans.

Just as Misty and Pikachu were about to run over and help the kid out, they fell to the ground, courtesy of bolas that were thrown and wrapped around their feet.

"Don't even think about moving..." Said a girl with dark blue hair in a braid and hair ribbon, wearing red overalls over a pink shirt. She stood over Misty, with a double barreled shotgun pointed at her.

Now, Misty may have been stronger than the girl, and perhaps she DID have a mallet... But with the shotgun pointed so up close to her face, she probably wouldn't be able to retaliate effectively without getting a face full of pellets. So of course, Misty complied.

"Where do you people get off... Thinking you can just come in here and steal innocent Pokemon from their homes whenever you want. The nerve!" The girl said with a growl.

"Who do you think we are, Team Rocket?! I would never do what those poachers do!" Misty said angrily.

The girl with the gun paused in thought as she studied Misty's reaction. Slowly putting the gun away, the girl moved cautiously and proceeded to undo the bolas that tied up Misty and Pikachu.

"Sorry about that... I'm... Well... I'll explain later... First, we need to get your friend down from there..."

She pointed a thumb up towards poor Ash as he hung by the seat of his pants in what looked to be an uncomfortable wedgie, courtesy of the branch on the log.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: ..., likely unintentionally, leave Ash in a wed...

choices: Yes, she saw him earlier after he got out of the water. He seemed fine.
No, but she'll certainly help look for him. How hard can it be?
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Uh, why does this keep happening? Ash thought as he watched Misty climb up the tree to free him. The branch on the log had not only caught the seat of his pants, it had also suspended him a good distance off the ground since the log itself had almost immediately proceeded to get itself caught up in the tree it swung towards. The universe just loves to make things hard for me.

"Hang on Ash, I'll have you out in a sec." The redhead was now climbing onto the branch that the log itself was stuck on. Fortunately, she didn't have any trouble getting over to him. "Hanging in there alright Ash?" she asked, having even less trouble making a joke.

"Ha ha." he said sarcastically. "Just get me off of this thing." Complying, she reached down and proceeded to grab his briefs. "W-wait! "Not li- Ah!" And just like that, she wedgied him up and off of the branch. As the branch was clearly strong, she had no problem standing straight up so that he was now suspended by her hands on his blue with vertical while stripes undies. More unfortunately, with his pants still stuck on the log's branch, they were now pulled off and fell down to the ground.

"Uh he-" The mysterious girl cover her mouth with one hand to stifle her laughter, not quite believing what she was seeing.

""Ahhh!" Ash''s hands moved to the front of his briefs, trying in vain to hide them from this new girl. "Misty!"

"Yeah yeah, keep your pants on. Or off. Whatever." She said as she lowered the boy onto the the tree branch, where he proceeded to rush down the tree to reclaim his pants.

One minute of redressing and mystery girl calming down from her giggle fit later.

"Alright, so who are you anyways? And what's with there being so many traps around here?" Misty asked.

"Right, I suppose I owe you some explanation I'm Melanie." Okay, one question answered. "I set up these traps to protect the Pokemon around here."

"Huh? Wouldn't traps be more of a danger to Pokemon?" Ash asked.

"Let me explain a bit more. I take care of wounded Pokemon that I find around here and prevent people from stealing them away. The traps help with that."

"Ohhhhhhhh..." Well that certainly made more sense. With some of the danger of the situation now gone, Ash suddenly remembered a much more urgent matter. "Oh crap, we still gotta find Brock!"

Does Melanie know where Brock is?
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: The mysterious girl introduces herself, and the...

choices: Team Rocket attacks, and Ash gains a new Pokemon (with help from Butterfree)
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
"Brock?" Melanie tilted her head; "Who's that?"

"He's our traveling companion and friend." Misty said, her face expressing worry; "When we tried to cross the rope bridge, Brock fell into the river below and got swept away! We don't know where he is, but we have to find him!"

"Wait... Hold on a minute..." Melanie thought a bit; "I saw a guy close to my age getting swept by the river and got him out before he drowned. He was half choked with water, but otherwise he was still breathing... He had dark tanned skin with a decent build and squinty eyes... Does your friend look anything like that?"

"Yeah!" said Ash; "Is he all right?"

"He's resting in my cabin... I'll take you both to see him." Melanie said with a gentle smile.
--

Soon enough, Melanie took the kids and Pikachu to the hidden 'village' where she cared for the Pokemon that lived in the area. Just as they were about to go into the cabin, however...

"Bulba!"

Ash and Misty turned sharply to at the sound, only to find the same bulbasaur from before. Ash showed great caution as he put his hands up defensively, since this WAS the same tough little froggy-plant-creature... Thing... from the incident with that oddish. He certainly still didn't look happy to see them, considering that his trademark vine whips come out of the sides of the critter's bulb on his back, moving aggressively like snakes giving out a warning before getting ready to strike.

"Pi-i, kaaa, chuuu Kachu!" Pikachu said as he walked up to the grass type Pokemon; "Pi pika-pika, ka'ka kaa pika Chu kachu pika-pika!"

"Bulbasaaaaaurrr" Bulbasaur relaxed a bit. He then gave everyone but Melanie the "I'm watching you gesture" with one of his vines. He then walked up to Melanie, who picked him up and pet him.

"I'm sorry about that... He's very protective of the Pokemon that live here...." Melanie said.

Not to mention feisty... Misty and Ash both thought at the same time.
--

Thankfully, Brock was unharmed, though the river definitely sapped him of his strength with how much he was being pushed about.Thankfully for him, because of his state, Bulbasaur didn't act hostile towards him. But it didn't mean Bulbasaur would just throw caution into the wind.

Though soon enough, Bulbasaur would come to find that perhaps not all trainers were bad...
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Yes, she saw him earlier after he got out of th...

1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Team Rocket's sudden attack was proving to be far too much of a problem in Melanie's opinion. She'd taken aim at them almost immediately, and then they had to go and turn on what could only be described as a giant vacuum. Suddenly, it was a struggle just to hold onto her gun, let alone aim, with the winds trying to suck everyone in and getting inside quickly took priority over attacking. "Everyone okay?" she asked, glancing over them.

"Yeah!" they all said quickly. Her eyes locked on Ash though.

"Um, Ash..." The boy looked down and saw that, without him having noticed, the wind from the vacuum had pulled his pants down while he helping Bulbasaur get inside.

"Are you kidding?!" he exclaimed as he frantically pulled his pants back up.

While did that, Brock asked, "Any chance you have something that can deal with that?"

Melanie shook her head. "I never made preparations for having to fight off a giant vacuum. How do they even have that? WHY do they even have it? With however much that must cost, you could probably buy a hundred Pokeballs and do what actual trainers do!"

Having gotten his pants back on, Ash suddenly noticed that a certain someone was missing. "Hey, where's Bulbasaur?"

Outside


"I must say James, this is going even better than I thought it would." Jessie said.

"Indeed. With this thing on, those twerps can't even step outside. Let alone attack."

"Uh, guys." Meowth said while pointing to the top of the cabin. "What's that little vegetable doin'?"

On the top of the cabin, Bulbasaur remained attached to the roof in spite of the suction pulling him in as his vines shot out and swatted the vacuum away from the cabin.

Taking advantage of the momentary reprieve, Ash quickly ran out of the cabin and deployed Butterfree while calling out for a Gust attack. As Butterfree flapped his wings, the vacuum turned back to the cabin again. As Gust collided with the vacuum's suction, the whirling winds transformed into a truly epic tornado that slammed right into Team Rocket and their insane contraption, sending them off flying.

Later...

"So run this by me again, you want me to take Bulbasaur because why?" Ash asked.

"As nice as it is to have him here, it just wouldn't be right to keep him here. The little village I've got here isn't exactly big enough for his bulb to grow."

Ash just stared at her, clearly not sure what to make of that. "That's a thing? That makes no- YEOW!" He was cut off as Misty gave his undies a sharp pull from behind.

"Ash, I swear, the next time we're in a proper town, I am getting you the latest book on Pokemon so that you will stop being surprised by things like this." With that done, she let go of his briefs.

"Besides that," Melanie further explained, "I'm worried he might be a little too good at his job. The Pokemon are getting more and more hesitant to move away from the village with him watching over them, and it's only a matter of time until I run out of room for them all. And i do think he's warming up to you. Especially with how you and Butterfree destroyed that machine."

Ash thought that over for a moment. He knew that he would still need some more Pokemon, and Bulbasaur would be a great choice. He already has a bug, water, flying, and electric type. Adding a grass type seemed like the next most logical choice.

Alright," he smiled, "I can't really argue with that."

So what comes next?

Option 1: Misty helps Ash practice with Bulbasaur. And while they're at it, she finds a good use for vine whip that she conspiratorially whispers to the grass type. Spanking Time!

Option 2: While helping Ash practice with Bulbasaur, she sneakily convinces the little plant Pokemon the use Razor Leaf on Ash's pants, keeping him in his underwear for a while until she can fix them up. She will FIERCELY deny that this is sewing, it's MENDING. A skill that all people who plan to spend a lot of time in the woods should know.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Team Rocket attacks, and Ash gains a new Pokemon

1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
Ash and Misty, in the meantime, were prepping for Ash and Butterfree's match with Bulbasaur.

After having done a couple of exercises to help the butterfly like Pokemon get used to using his wings (along with some coaching from Pidgeotto's), they stopped for a break.

Pidgeotto pat Butterfree on the back with his wing, letting him now that he was doing quite well for a newly evolved Pokemon.

"Reeeee" Butterfree said to Pidgeotto in gratitude.

"Times like this where I wish I could speak Pokemon..." Ash said with a chuckle.

Misty giggled at the thought, finding herself agreeing with him. She then looked down at Pikachu, a lightbulb going off in her head as she knelt down to the Pokemon's level and whispered into his ear an interesting idea.

Pikachu tilted his head in confusion, but nontheless complied with a nod.

"Thanks Pikachu..." Misty flashed him a smile.
---

The match between Butterfree and Bulbasaur soon commenced, with Bulbasaur's experience as the village's bodyguard giving him the edge as his vine whips made it difficult for Butterfree to use Tackle on him.

It didn't help that Bulbasaur was surprisingly nimble for a squat little Pokemon, effectively dodging some string shots here and there before leaping at a tree and spring boarded towards Butterfree, who narrowly avoided getting slammed by the larger Pokemon.

Ash knew he that if he was going this bout, Bulbasaur would need to be slowed down in some way. Than it hit him...

"Butterfree, blow him into the air with gust!"

Butterfree immediately flapped his wings as hard as he could and sent Bulbasaur flying, though he managed to stop himself by using vine whip to stop himself from being completely blown away by wrapping around a tree branch.

"Saaaaaur!" Bulbasaur gritted as he tried to formulate a plan to launch a counter attack.

"Now, send some stun spore into the air currents!" Ash said.

Butter free did just that, letting the gust carry the spore over to Bulbasaur, effectively paralyzing him long enough for Ash to send a pokeball out and officially catching him.
--

After saying their goodbyes (with Melanie telling Misty to be a bit more merciful on Ash's underpants), the group eventually found a place to stay for the night, where Misty was waiting for Ash to get back from practicing with Pidgeotto.

As soon as Ash walked into the room and closed the door behind him, Misty looked his way with an innocent smile.

"Say Ash, I was thinking a little bit about how Bulbasaur might feel as member of your team. So I had Pikachu talk to him."

Ash raised an eyebrow at this.

"From what I was able to guess, based on Pikachu playing charades, Bulbasaur was fine with it. Though aside from the battle, he thinks he should also do a little 'initiation'..."Misty's expression had a mischief filled glint. "Just so you two could seal the deal.."

"What do you-"

"Bulbaaa"

Ash turned his head to the right and saw Bulbasaur come out from under a bed. Who gave him the same sort of expression as Misty as his vines came out of the sides of his bulb.

"Uh oh..." Ash gulped as he slowly stepped back.

After hat, the room was filled with the sound of swatting, and Ash's squealing.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Option 1

choices: An option here just for the sake of being here.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
One vine wrapped around Ash, pinning his arms to his side. "H-hey, wait!" Ash said, panicking, already guessing what Misty had arranged.

"Now now Ashy-boy, don't you remember the little rule I set back in Pewter City?" Ash gave her a questioning look so she continued. "When the two of us are safely behind closed doors, you get those pants off. here, I'll give you a hand."

Ash squirmed as Misty began unbuttoning his pants. "Han-hang on, I can do do it myself!" he said blushing. There was just something infinitely more embarrassing about having her remove his pants for him. Nonetheless, she still continued her actions and removed his pants. "And the pants are off. Now one more touch." Grabbing the back of his briefs, she yanked upwards to expose more of his butt, making him wince. "And now we can begin."

"Eeeep!" Ash squealed as Bulbasaur's free vine whipped his backside. "OW!" A vine-shaped red print could already be seen forming on his backside. The swats to his butt not only continued though, they started gradually picking up speed while the boy squealed and his redheaded mentor kept her eyes locked on his backside, enjoying the view.

A few days later...

"Okay, any idea where we are right now?" Misty asked. "I feel like we've seen that same rock like five times."

"No, that one's bigger than the last one." Ash said.

"Well that still doesn't help!"

Ash sighed. "Brock, you've got the map. Where are we?"

Looking over the map, Brock traced over the last spot he was sure they had been over to the the direction they've been going. "It looks like we're in the middle of nowhere." That got him a couple of groans. "The good news though is that if we keep going straight, we'll reach Route 24 soon. And that'll take us straight to Vermilion City."

"Great." Ash said. "Then let's- why is it suddenly darker out?" The trio and Pikachu found a shadow going over them. looking to it's source, they found it was a Charmander. reading over its information on his Pokedex, Ash was excited at the chance to finally catch a fire type. "Alright! Vapoer- Ugh!"

Before he could even throw his Pokeball, Ash was stopped by Misty pulling on the back of his tighty whities. "Ash, try and be a little quiet, you don't wanna spook it."

"We might have another problem." Brock said. "Take a look at it's flame. It looks pretty small for a Charmander. I think it might need some help."

Ash considered this for a moment. if the Charmander was weak, then he could catch it easily enough and then take it to a Pokemon center. And so he tried to do just that, only for the Charmander to resist. And resist the second time when Brock tried it. After some debate, they had Pikachu go up and talk to it.

Upon returning, Pikachu explained, as best he could, that the Charmander was a "he," already had a trainer, and was waiting for him to return. "Huh, well, I guess there's not much we can do then."

Brock nodded. "His trainer should be back sooner or later and we can't exactly just take him." With that decided, our group started to move onward. Not noticing the subtle signs in the clouds of a storm getting ready to roll in.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: "Charmander – The Stray Pokémon"  Wedgie

choices: The trio rains down righteous fury!
Nurse Joy stops the impending brawl
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
At the Pokemon center, Brock was sitting on a chair after his Pokemon were taken in for a check-up.

He looked around at the amount of hustle and bustle going on as trainers came in to protect themselves from the storm.

I hope that charmander's safe and sound... Brock thought to himself; Wouldn't want to be him with thouse clouds growing darker.

Than, laughter akin to a flock of pidgey filled his ear.
-

"Check'em out mates!" A boy with blue hair, a pink shirt, and jeans said in a British accent as he showed them the amount of pokeballs he had. "Caught'em all in just an hour!"

"Holy Tauros Damien, that's gotta be a record!" One boy said.

"Naturally~" Damien said with a chuckle.

"Wait... I just remembered something. Don't you have a charmander?"

"HAD one... Little pissant was so weak that I had to get rid of 'im. Probably couldn't even take down a metapod if his life depended on it! So I left the stupid little bugger on some rock... And the stupid bastard actually thinks I'm going to come back for it!" Damien chortled.

"Psh... If he can"t make it on his own out there, it serves him right for being so weak! That's the way nature works after all!" Another boy said with a horrid grin.
-

And like that, Brock had just about heard enough...

With fists clenched, Brock promptly got up from his seat and immediately walked over to where Damien and his groupies were. Due to being bigger and stronger, Brock was able to quite easily drag Damien away. He then proceeded to SLAM him against a wall by slamming the trainer's back to the wall, proceeding to pin him there by pushing his forearm against Damien's neck.

"H-hey! What the hell?! What the sodding hell's your problem?!" Damien asked he tried to get free.

"Charmander..." Brock said, his voice sounding eerily calm.

"What?" Damien asked.

"You're his trainer, right?..." Brock asked. "Then go get him...."

"Well sorry, but it looks like I'll have to take a rain check on that-" Damien gagged when he suddenly felt Brock press his forearm against his neck even further.

"Do I look like I'm laughing here?" Brock asked, with a certain venom in his voice as he brought his face dangerously closer; '"Get your sorry ass out there, and help your Pokemon. NOW..."

Just as Damien's friends walked over to back Damien up, Ash and Misty blocked their path with anger in their eyes; Misty cracking her knuckles threateningly and Ash looking about ready to knock some teeth out.

And Pikachu?

He desperately wanted to fill the punks with Lord knows how many kilowatts of electricity.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Later, at the Pokemon Center.

choices: Reader's choice on how to proceed.
Reader's choice on how to proceed.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
"Alright ENOUGH!" said the Nurse Joy.

"Nurse Joy, he-"

"No!" she said firmly. "I've only overheard a little of what you're all talking about, and regardless of what's been done, I won't have a brawl breaking out in the middle of a Pokemon Center of all places."

Taking advantage of the what only be described as undeserved luck, Damien and his crew promptly made a run for it.

Brock was extremely tempted to go after them and show them how much harm could be done with rock types, assuming he could even wait the few seconds that would be needed to let out a Pokemon before attacking with his own hands again. Unfortunately, he knew that there was a much more immediate problem that had to be dealt with first. The storm outside was picking up, and Charmander was still out there.

Later (because I really don't feel like just writing down entire segments of the episode)...

Rescuing the Charmander had proved simple enough, even with the storm raging on outside and getting a large dose of electricity. After wrapping up the Charmander in jackets and blankets alike, it was Brock who carried the steadily worsening Pokemon back, his own speed being surprisingly faster than his companions (ironic given his specialty is rock types). Nurse Joy's capable hands were able to mend Charmander as hoped, leaving our trio 0and Pikachu) to wait.

"So what are we going to do about Damien?" Ash asked.

"Assuming he's gone, which he probably is seeing how fast they all bolted earlier, we probably won't get the chance to decide." Misty grumbled.

"What we need to worry about is Charmander." Brock interjected. "Much as most anyone would want to be done with Damien after something like that, Pokemon aren't exactly known to give up on their trainers easily. No matter how much they should." It was an unfortunate truth. Once a Pokemon felt bonded with its trainer, they could be far too loyal.

"Then we'll just have to show him he's better off with us." Ash said. "I mean, I'd say we're already off to a good start with that."

Brock nodded his head, his mind consumed with working out how to proceed.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Hospitals, even Pokemon Centers, are not arenas.

choices: Damien gets a much deserved whoopin' (and wedgie) from Misty
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
"Guys! Guys, wake up!"

Brock, Ash, and Pikachu's eyes fluttered open as the two stirred themselves awake. Misty looked at them with a panicked expression on her face.

"Misty? What's wrong" Ash asked.

"I went to check up on Charmander while you were sleeping, he's gone!" Misty exclaimed.

Brock immediately got out of bed and ran out the door to the room Charmander was supposed to be sleeping with his friends right behind him. Sure enough, he was indeed missing!

"He must've gone back to the rock!" Ash banged a fist against the glass wall.

"We better make sure he's all right..." Brock said with conviction.
--

After leaving the center, the trio immediately began searching for the little guy. Even though rain had thankfully stopped, the clouds still covered the sky. Naturally, they needed to find him before it started to rain again. The poor little guy's flame nearly went out last night, and they couldn't take any chances at this point.

Pikachu, thankfully, was on the case, using his nose to track Charmander by his scent.

And soon enough? They found him the tall grass, on his way to the rock. What's more? The flame on his tail looked brighter and bigger than it did last night!

"Man, you had us worried there little guy!" Brock said with a sigh of relief, kneeling down to his level; "Well, we're glad that you're at least safe from harm!"

Charmander looked at Brock with a look of surprise, tilting his head with surprise.

"There you are!"

The trio turned around, only for Pikachu's cheeks to start spark angrily as they watched Damien walk over.

Misty growled at Damien as he swaggered over; "Just what do YOU want?"

"Isn't obvious?" Damien jeered; "I came back to take what's mine!"

Pikachu shook his head as he said something to Charmander.

"Ch-char" Charmander stood there, unsure what to do.

"Why should he have to come with you?" Ash asked angrily.

"Because I'm HIS trainer, you stupid git!" Damien said; "Sides! Me leaving him out there probably helped toughen him up! Hardly could even call him a decent Pokemon if he couldn't win a battle!"

"You left your own Pokemon out to possibly die out in the wilderness..." Brock said, ready to knock Damien's teeth out; " And yet, you have the GAUL to call yourself his trainer?!"

"Tch, you'll see!" Damien said as he got a pokeball out and faced Charmander; " Return..."

Charmander backed up slowly.

"I said return!"

Still no response.

"I said-" Damien backed off when Charmander sent out an Ember attack at him, narrowly missing his head; "Oh, so that's how you want it ?"

Damien immediately picked up a fallen branch, still damp from the rain and slowly walked towards Charmander menacingly.

Brock and Ash blocked his way, only to have to dodge a swipe or two from Damien. But soon, he left himself wide open for Misty to suddenly knock the branch out of his hand with her mallet. The instant Damien was recovering from being disarmed, Misty immediately started tackling the abusive trainer after handing her mallet to Ash and Brock.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: The next morning

choices: Similar to canon progression or Somethign completely different.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
What followed actually had Ash and even Brock taking a couple steps back as Misty proceeded to wallop the abusive trainer she had pinned down. "I swear." Punch. "It is like talking to." Punch! "An ignorant sociopath!" PUNCH. "Some assholes have the decency to at least pretend like they're not a sadistic prick!" Punch, punch, another punch.

"Urghhhhhh..." was all the bruised and bloodied Damien could get out as Misty stood up from him, only to let a sharp cry as she pulled him up by the front of his underwear, spun him around several times by them, and then tossed him straight into a tree.."Owhow..."

Brock turned to Charmander and asked, "Feel like getting a little revenge of your own?"

"Char-" the Lizard sucked in a breath, "-MANDER!" Flames spewed from his mouth and collided with Damien's backside, sending the guy running as he frantically tried to put out the, admittedly light, flames. "Charmander."

Emergency divergence point...

Will we now proceed with the story in a line sort of similar to canon, something completely different, or the idea that 45Powerman discussed with me?
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Damien gets a much deserved whoopin' (and ...

choices: Misty and Squirtle race to save Ash, while dealing w/Team Rocket.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
On a fine sunny day, Brock and Ash had released Bulbasaur and Charmander out of their pokeballs for exercise.

For Ash, it was so that he could gain experience in working with his new Grass type. Whereas for Brock, he expressed a desire to help Charmander get a little more confident in being with him

At first, it started off with the two starter Pokemon practicing their respective moves with their respective trainers, until Bulbasaur unexpectedly came over to Charmander after seeing him move around in a stiff, one directional, and linear fashion, as opposed something more multidirectional. At least, more so than his species should be, considering the speed and agility of his evolution line.

When the fire type explained his previous experience under Damien (who apparently only really taught him to just attack and nothing else), Bulbasaur's usual dry wit was replaced with soft understanding as he placed a vine on Charmander's shoulder.

Thankfully, having honed his own fighting skills from warding off trainers attempting to steal the Pokemon Melanie was attending to, he obviously knew a thing or two when it came to a fight. So it was at that point, that Bulbasaur took it upon himself to help Charmander not only learn to take advantage of his own natural speed and agility, but to also improve his technique in personal paw-to-paw(?) combat.

So naturally, he began using his vine whips to fix Charmander's posture, while also explaining to him the benefits of fluidity and agility in movement, along with dodging while in the midst of combat.

Although their respective trainers didn't speak Pokemon, they were still impressed with this little interaction.

Misty smiled as she watched them while she leaned against a tree with Pikachu next to her legs. Pikachu's ears twitched as the mouse heard something. He then ran off to investigate, only to find that, to his shock, that the humans' bags were missing!

He quickly alerted everyone to the situation, everyone to search for whoever had taken the bags.
--

"Hey! Give those back!" Ash exclaimed as he looked at the culprits after the group found them.

As it turned out, the bags were taken by a gang of squirtles, all of them wearing sunglasses. Naturally, after being hearing this, the leader of them (who had a pair that were particularly pointy and v-shaped) just seemed to tell his group to keep eating.

"They don't belong to you!" Brock said to them sternly, only for the bipedal turtles to actually mock the humans, with one of the gang members even giving them the middle finger during the taunting. And let's just say that if Ash could speak fluently in pokemon language, he'd be LIVID if he heard what one of the squirtles said about his mother.

Still, seeing as they weren't liking this one bit, the humans were about to go on towards the gang of Pokemon and give them a piece of their mind, only for them to each narrowly avoid a Water Gun to the face.

Bulbasaur growled in anger at the thieving water pokemon's obnoxious behavior, using Take Down to knock them off their feet. Not wanting the gang to potentially outflank Bulbasaur, Pikachu and Charmander opted to join the fray (with Charmander using the previous coaching from Bulbasaur to decent effect as he avoided a Water Gun).In spite of their efforts, however well they were doing in the brawl with the squirtles, the gang of squirtles still managed to get away with the food, though thankfully that was the only thing they took as they left the bags.
--

"Tell me, did the squirtles happen to all wear sunglasses?" Officer Jenny asked when the gang reported the theft at the nearby town's police station.

"Yeah... It was kinda odd, yet kinda cool at the same time... Though they were still being jerks..." Ash said, still clearly irritated from the earlier incident.

"Of course it was them..." Officer Jenny muttered, pinching the bridge of her nose.

"You know those Pokemon?" Misty asked with a raised eyebrow.

"Unfortunately, yes..." Officer Jenny said, with an 'I'm so sick of this crap' expression on her face; "People around here call them the 'Squirtle Squad'..."

Interesting use of alliteration... Brock thought.


As Officer Jenny explained to them, the Squirtle Squad ran wild as rogues in the area they were in, on account of having been abandoned by their trainers.

The squirtles themselves weren't malicious by any means, but they were notorious for being a gang of delinquents. They mainly spent their time stealing food, writing graffiti (some of them were of a crude, vulgar, and R-rated nature), causing trouble for trainers that were traveling through the area, pulling pranks, and just being overall nuisances.

Still, with all of this in mind, the gang let Officer Jenny know they'd be on alert, now that they knew what they were dealing with.
--

While the group were at a cafe, Ash sat there, his mind filled with quite a few things... Only to see something out of the corner of his eye. He turned his head, and saw a couple of familiar looking squirtles with round framed sunglasses seemingly walking casually, until they suddenly took a bunch of apples from a stand, making the shop keeper yell angrily.

In spite of failing to stop the squirtles from taking the food from his groups own bags, Ash decided to make up for it by running off after them.

As the others (Pikachu included) followed, their paths were blocked by a couple of other members of the squad.

Ash's face became more frustrated as he ran after the little delinquents outside of the woods, surprised that such small Pokemon with stubby legs could move as quickly as they did. Still, he was determined to stop them from causing himself and the others any more grief, even if it meant catching one of them.

He didn't, unfortunately, expect to be dogpiled after an ambush was set up. And as he was struggling, he didn't notice some light blue fingers creeping into his pants and grab his waistband. After that, the Pokemon proceeded to yank the poor boy's black and white polka dotted briefs until they were realeased.

The turtle-like Pokemon laughed as they made their get away, leaving Ash to continue the chase, though he moved slower as he was trying to run while prying his briefs from his crack.

Eventually, after he managed to finally corner them somewhat, he brought out Butterfree and Pidgeotto to help .

During the ensuing scuffle between his Pokemon and the delinquents, however, Ash was accidentally sent flying into the nearby lake by a stray Water Gun.

Ash brought his head above the surface of the deeper end, spitting out water. He was about to yell at them, when he heard some of the Pokémon on the shore (even the squirtles surprisingly enough) call out a warning.

While Ash was wondering what exactly the big deal was all about, he got his answer in the form of a splash from behind him. Ash's face turned white when he saw a wild seaking, looking none too pleased at him for being in the fish's territory; which gave Ash the incentive necessary to try and swim to shore.

Ash may have been in decent shape as much as a boy his age could be, but he was still only human. While the seaking, on the other hand, was naturally well suited as a powerful swimmer, moving with great agility and speed in the water despite his size, shown by how easily he blocked his path; while also managing to keep Pidgeotto and Butterfree at bay with Water gun, and a well aimed slap of his mighty tail when some of the squirrels tried to help.

Ash was barely managing to avoid getting skewered, though he still received some considerable scratches from the fish's horn during some close calls. Unfortunately, because of the slight blood loss, as well as the aggressive Pokémon's superior speed, he couldn't keep up for long...

Ash's friends arrived when they heard all the commotion, only for their blood to run cold as they saw the speaking's horn spear through the roughed up boy's pant leg, though the tip of it still managed to penetrate the skin severely, making Ash scream out in pain while he was being lifted out of the water by the fish.

"ASH!" Misty and Brock cried out in shock.

Vaporeon suddenly popped out of her pokeball, and into the water, possibly sensing Ash's distress. Seeing her trainer in peril, she immediately latched herself onto the fish's back. Vaporeon didn't exactly use Bite, but she still made the seaking grimace in pain from the way she had latched her jaws on the back of the Pokémon's head.

While the seaking was thrashing about, trying to get the biting and scratching water Pokemon off of him, he actually threw Ash off of his horn quite a few meters away from him.

As soon as Vaporeon saw her trainer had gained distance from the wild Pokémon, she leapt off of the wild Pokémon, slapping him away with a smack from her tail as she swam to her trainer, using her teeth to grab her trainer by the jacket and pulled him to shore, making sure to keep his head above the water.
-
Unfortunately for everyone (Ash's Pokemon included), they learned that aside from the scratches the seaking left, the wild Pokémon also inflicted a serious looking gash on the poor boy's thigh.

While Brock was doing the best he could to stop the bleeding, he needed better medical equipment to help with the wound, either some stitches or a super potion; something from the stores selling medical supplies back in town.

With determination in his eyes, the Squirtle Squad's leader tapped Misty on the shoulder, and basically let her know that he was willing to help Misty save the life of her boyfriend- I mean, friend. Because he and the squad knew the area better, it was best he led Misty to the route to town and back that was quickest.

And so, the two raced while everyone else stayed to watch over Ash.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: "Here Comes the Squirtle Squad" Wedgie edition

choices: At the underwear shop. Misty buys underoos while Ash buys his briefs
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
"Wow Ash, I surprised you'er still able to walk after that" Misty said as she looked at Ash as he walked beside her.

"Just... barely..." Ash did his best to walk properly. The pain was still there as though he was still receiving the wedgie. "Misty... please, eh... never give me wedgie like that ever again..."

"Oh, but though you were starting to enjoy them, especially after last night" Misty said teasingly.

Ash blushed "That was just a thank you for training me! Nothing more! I've lost enough underwear from all the wedgies you've been giving me! So I'd like them to stop thank you very much." He said crossing his arms.

Misty looked at him with an eyebrow "Was that a demand I just heard." she said in a serious tone.

Ash got nervous. "No! I ,eh I meant, eh, I was, eh, mm, eh" He tried to say but was too scared to make any sense. Misty then put her finger on his mouth to quiet him. "You helped me deal with my sisters so I'll give you a painless punishment, deal?"

Ash sighed in relief and took the deal without a second though. Sure it was a punishment but a painless one meant no wedgies or spankings and right now Ash felt he could a break from both of them.

"You are right though, about losing underwear. I know good shop we can buy from. Lets head there." Misty said as she pulled Ash by his arm.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: Misty takes Ash with her to pick up some extra ...

choices: They leave, go to the Pokemon center to wait for Brock. Misty has some fun.
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
At the Shop


"Underoos!" Ash muttered under his breath to Misty to avoid making a since. "Why?!"

Misty sighted "Because, Ash, this is for your punishment. You'er going to be wearing underoos till we reach the next town. Plus last I checked we were going buy you underoos back in Pewter city, but we didn't, you agreed to remain in a hanging wedgie while I bought you briefs instead underoos. And we both remember how I found you. Don't we?" she said looking at Ash.

Ash shivered remembering the absolute agony his butt went through when Misty found not in his wedgie. "B-Bu-But I, eh, I" Ash tried to think of something to rebut Misty but he had to face it. She was right. He didn't hold his end of the deal back in Pewter. He frowned realizing that there was no avoiding it. He was going to be wearing underoos.

"Now then, if you'er done arguing, buy your briefs quickly." Misty said hurrying Ash.

Ash did as he was told picking out his briefs while also looking at the underoos Misty was holding. The underoos were all sores of colors. Some were blue with water Pokemon patterns, green with grass Pokemon patterns, red with fire Pokemon patterns, and he really blushed when he saw a yellow ones with Pikachu patterns.

All Ash could be do was *Gulp* at the site of them.

----------------------------

What happens next?
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.title: At the underwear shop. Misty buys underoos whil...

choices: "...wedging him altogether. Then we can each get some one on one time with him!"
1212111122222112111211112121111112111111.content:
(A/N: This one will proceed in much the same way that 45Powerman's very well written first option for the previous addition, then follow with a nice twist in a new direction midway through.)

While Ash and Brock were playing with their Pokemon, with Ash having won the Cerulean gym badge, things were pretty cheerful.

Misty looked at Ash with a warm smile on her face, beyond glad to know that the boy was making progress as a trainer. And what's more? There was a twinkle in his eye that practically glowed with exuberance from having not just earned his badge, but from actually impressing his coach/mentor.

He still had a long way to go, but she had a feeling that the boy would be going places in the future. All he had to was to keep at it is all.

"Hey, uh, sis? Could we talk to you in private?" Violet asked as she tapped Misty's shoulder.

"Hmm?" Misty turned around and saw all three of her big sisters standing in front of her. "Sure, what about?"

"Something important..." Daisy said.
--

------------

The day went on with Misty taking the badge from Ash and leaving him and Brock to train and take care of supplies, while she thought of a way for Ash to earn his badge.

Nighttime had fallen.

Ash waited in the room wondering when Misty was coming back. Brock decided to sleep as Ash was about to do the same Misty opened the door. Pikachu was happy to see again and so was Ash.

"Hey Misty, where have you been?" Ash asked

"Come with me to the woods Ash," Misty replied.

Both Pikachu and Ash looked at each other confused but did as she said and followed her.
---------

As they walked Misty spoke.

"So what you think of my sisters?"

Ash replied. "Yeah, they're..... eh, they don't seem to be interested in gym battles... for a bunch of gym leaders."

"Yeah, they're more interested in looking beautiful and performing. They do love Pokemon, in fact they take really good care of them. They just have all most no interset when it comes to Pokemon battles. Probably because they don't how to battle." Misty said signing.

Ash thought for a moment and spoke. "Why don't you show them then?"

Misty looked at Ash with an eyebrow raised. "What do you mean?"

"I mean why don't we battle tomorrow in front of your sisters? Should them what you're made of. Should them how much fun Pokemon battles are when you know what you're doing."

Misty was surprised "I don't know, Are you sure Ash? I mean-

"What afraid you'll lose?" Ash said cutting Misty off.

"What no I-"

Ash cut her off again "I already took the badge from them, so maybe the only reason don't wanna battle me is because you'll lose." he said pretending to be cocky.

"Hey, I can beat you easily!" Misty said annoyed

"Ok then let's bet on it..." Ash took a deep breath before speaking. "If I win I get to give you a wedgie!"

Misty raised her eyebrow as she heard this. "And if I win what happens?"

Ash grew nervous, "I-if yo-you win, eh, you'll get to.., to... to... eh, buy me underoos..."

Misty eyes lit up and smirked. "Oh it a deal!"

--------

They made their way to the woods, as soon as Misty stopped by a tree she turned to Ash.

"Ash, do you remember the hanging atomic wedgie I gave you?"

Ash shivered at thought of that wedgie " How could I? It was the worst one you gave me..."

"Well I gave you one version of it, I'm going to give you the other version."

Ash's heart sank. "What?! W-Why?!"

"You see this tree? Your badge is at the very top of this tree in a small case. Now when I give you an atomic wedgie and then hang you by your legholes on the lowest branch, I will quiz you, for every right answer you give I will carry you to a branch higher, you will also get spanked with my paddle 5 times. If answer wrong you will remain on the branch but still receive your spanking. This will continue until you can reach the case and grab it or throw in the towel, it's your choice. This will be painful so I even brought this lotion for your rear."

Ash gulp nervously. The wedgie alone sounded painful and far worse than the other hanging atomic, he looked up at the tree it was really tall. He knew this was going to long, painful and ever so humiliating... But still, he wanted to be the greatest pokemon master and becoming that meant more to him than anything. Ash looked Misty in the eyes and said...

"I'll do it... whatever it takes... I'll do it."

Misty smiled at his determination. "We'll see, Now then strip down till your underwear."

We've been lost for two days now and running so low on food were beginning to eat berries and its thanks to Ash not buying a map and leading us in this forest. And we still haven't caught a single Pokemon. By this rate I'll miss the contest. His gym stadiums are not going anywhere... He eh, deserves whats coming to him..."

After an awkward pause May just ran of to Ash not before reminding Max to keep Brock busy.

As he got changed he hoped Ash would be alright. He did agree it is because of Ash that they were lost and was mad at him for that but maybe the punishment he was getting was a bit too much.

121212211112121211.content:
While Max was preparing to distract Brock, May headed off to her fun with Ash. Thankfully, it didn't take her long to find him, sitting on a rock by some trees and looking nervous. "Hello, Ash." she greeted cheerfully.

The boy jumped to his feet in surprise and fright before trying to laugh it off nervously. "Uh, h-hey May. So uh, what are we doing here?" he greeted and asked, worried about what would happen next.

Circling around him, she said, "Well, I was thinking about doing a little... weight lifting." She noticed him gulp in response. "And since we don't have any weights, that means I'll just have to improvise. So, first things first."

Before he could say anything, he felt her hand grab the sides of his white briefs and yank up, "YEOW! Nnn, M-maaayyyyyyyYY..."

Beginning to lift upwards to start her 'workout,' she asked, Yes?"

Whimpering as he felt his feet lift the ground, he struggled to get his words out. "I-I'm still re-Ahhh-all-eeeey sore from las-s-s-st n-night." Suddenly, her hands left his underwear and he dropped onto the ground, his legs collapsing and his butt hitting the floor. Even still, he sighed in relief.

May, meanwhile, consider things for a bit. I guess leaving him in that crack and groin destroying wedgie last night would make him pretty sore. Hmm, what to do, what to do? On one hand, she could just settle for making this session quick and rip those briefs right off him. That would certainly be fun. Or she could change tactics and give him a nice spanking instead. Maybe both? Decisions, decisions.

1212122112.content:
After a moment of thinking, May decided it would be best if she could find some way to use Ash's childish choice in underwear as blackmail, so she could get him to do pretty much anything she wanted. It was then she remembered a new feature Professor Birch had added to her Pokedex. The Professor had added a camera function to his Pokedex, so that May could take pictures of Pokemon in the wild, but May had thought of another use for it. Keeping one hand on the waistband of Ash's undies, she pulled out her Pokedex and prepared to take a photo.

"May please let-" Ash's question was cut off by the telltale *CLICK* sound of the camera's flash. Realizing what May was trying to do, Ash cried out "WAIT! MAY DON'T!" but his words fell upon deaf ears.

May continued taking photos for a minute, and once she was satisfied she let go of the boy's waistband. While Ash was busy adjusting his undies, May looked through the photos him took. Some of them were too blurry to make heads or tails of, but a fair few turned out rather well. There was one that showed the grey garment stretching out of his pants and up his back, another that was a close up on the undies themselves and clearly displayed the pokeball print that adorned them, and even one that managed to show Ash's shocked face and his wedgied undies in the same frame! All in all, May had more than enough evidence to show to anyone she wished.

Around this time Ash had finished fixing his underwear and was making his way over to where May was standing. "Alright how about I see just what pair of underwear you're wearing," he said.

Before he could make a move May held up the Pokedex to him, the screen showing the picture of his face looking back and his embarrassing underwear coming out of his pants. "I wouldn't do that if I were you. I took quite a few embarrassing photos of you, and if you don't do what I say then I might just have to show these photos to Brock and Max."

Ash stopped in his tracks and let out a bit of a gasp. It was bad enough having May knew about his juvenile choice in underwear, there was no way he could let Brock or Max find out! Brock would probably shrug it off and hopefully not mention it, but Max would never let him live it down. "A-Alright fine, I'll do whatever you want. Just don't tell anyone about this."

After hearing Ash say those words, May had a smile on her face that would make the Cheshire Cat jealous. But now that she had Ash under her thumb, what was she going to have him do? The others would still be gone for another hour or so...

125121.content:
Ash was kneeling, cradling his downed Pikachu in his arms. He and Paul had yet another battle and yet again, they had tied. This had set Paul off into mutterings about how his pokemon were still useless and pathetic losing to someone like Ash. Dawn was done with his endless comments and attitude.

He believed that a pokemon’s strength was the defining value of a pokemon. He pissed off Dawn, especially his constant belittling of Ash despite the two were quite often evenly matched, even with Ash being hard-headed and still not being very strategic.

Ash and Brock were heading off to get Ash’s pokemon healed at the nearby pokecenter. Dawn waved, “Yeah I got an errand to run you guys, I’ll catch up with you in a bit!” She then dashed down the trail that Paul had left on.

She eventually caught up to the boy, who was busy on his pokedex. Smirking she sneaked up behind him- “You know I saw you a while ago.” She squealed and jerked back a bit as Paul talked, the boy still focused on his dex.

“I don’t know why you are following me- a ridiculous hobby like competition. Who cares about the style and grace of a pokemon? What nonsense,” He said dismissing her passion without a second thought, leaving her fuming. Oh she had just the way to ruffle this arrogant kid’s feathers.

“Oh well see, I don’t know how one can have a strong pokemon when they’re incredibly weak.” Paul opened his mouth to say something witty but all he did was gasp, hands flying to his crotch as his purple boxers were forced deep into his butt by an angry Dawn, his waistband already halfway up his back.

“Now let’s have a trainer battle,” Dawn said with a smirk.

“You know Paul, I think you need to view my team with a new appreciation,” Dawn said, still holding the other trainer’s boxers up his back to his indignation and humiliation.

Pachirisu blew a kiss to Paul, whose eyes widened in shock as a heart flew from the Pokemon and hit Paul spot on. “Wha-what's, what's hap- what what's going-” He stammered, all resistance gone.

Dawn let go giggling, “Sweet Kiss causes confusion! Now while you're confused,” Dawn smirked evilly, quickly stripping the proud boy to his boxers, throwing his clothes in a nearby tree.

info.description:
Basically this is a revival of an old story I created, which I deleted since:

a.) Hardly anyone participated

b.) I lost the ability to create interactive stories (and had to buy a friggin' basic membership to get it back)…

-

Anywhooo, like most of my stories on this site, I have rules that I urge you to obey:

1.) If you want to add anything to the story, make sure your grammar and spelling are legible (this isn't a choice, it's a requirement)

2.) PROPER PARAGRAPH STRUCTURE (I can't emphasize that enough, I don't want to read a damn wall of text!)

3.) Don't forget, quotation marks were made for a reason.

4.) Girls are allowed to give wedgies, but shouldn't be on the recieving end.

5.) Keep the content at a PG-13 level

6.) Do NOT copy material from the stories on this file and try to paste it on a different file just so you can try to pass it off as your own.
